subject: multiple postdoc / research fellow  positions in swarm intelligence for collaborative robotics (ntu, singapore)
content: the centre for system intelligence and efficiency (exquisitus), school of electrical and electronic engineering at nanyang technological university, singapore, invites applications for multiple postdoc / research fellow positions in swarm intelligence for collaborative robotics, more specifically in 1) cooperative control and coordination of multi-robot systems, 2) cooperative navigation for multiple mobile robots, 3) collaborative manipulation of multiple robot manipulators, 4) fleet management of multiple robots. applicants should hold a ph.d degree in relevant areas; have expertise in at least one of the following areas: swarm intelligence, robot swarm and coordination, cooperative control of multi-robots, fleet management, or navigation and control of autonomous systems; have a track record of research experience in terms of high-quality journal publications, and / or, relevant project experience; have a good command of english. application procedure interested candidates are invited to email cv to assoc prof. guoqiang hu via gqhu at ntu.edu.sg<mailto:gqhu at ntu.edu.sg>. -- guoqiang hu (dr) | associate professor | director, centre for system intelligence and efficiency (exquisitus) | school of electrical & electronic  engineering | nanyang technological university | 50 nanyang avenue, singapore 639798 | tel: (65) 6790 4362 | email: gqhu at ntu.edu.sg<gqhu at ntu.edu.sg > | https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntu.edu.sg_home_gqhu_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ldakdlnmpldqgvviwc4ekwqv2fdz15wv5x92oijhvc0&s=2rjhyi3l7dcplwskr64qjfwyio2ldobxyvg4gmvsfd8&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntu.edu.sg_home_gqhu_&d=dwmfag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a0_li3z6me1ecwpb2r9uxvpvn2uswp_vkfswli0uadw&s=269qr4difiwmzgxidzbnqwnipqqueeyuhscfm0rrjty&e=> ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: faculty position in autonomy  (ae/irim-gatech)
content: faculty position in autonomy (ae/irim-gatech) the institute for robotics and intelligent machines and the school of aerospace engineering at the georgia institute of technology (georgia tech) invites nominations and applications for a faculty position in the general area of autonomous and intelligent systems. the appointment is expected to be at the assistant or associate professor level, but appointments at the full professor level will be considered for exceptional candidates having demonstrated a superior research and teaching record. candidates are expected to have a strong commitment to teaching at the undergraduate and graduate levels as well as to the development of an externally funded research program.  an earned doctorate in aerospace engineering, electrical engineering, computer science/engineering, software engineering or a closely related field is required. the aerospace engineering program at georgia tech is the largest program of its kind in the us, having approximately 40 full-time faculty members, and more than 800 undergraduate students and 500+ graduate students. its undergraduate and graduate programs are typically ranked among the top aerospace engineering programs in the nation. the research interests of the faculty cover a broad spectrum including gas dynamics, propulsion, combustion, aerodynamics, structural mechanics, flight mechanics, robotics and autonomy, orbital mechanics, rotorcraft, aircraft and space systems design, dynamics and control, air-traffic control, and cognitive engineering. information about the school can be found at www.ae.gatech.edu<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ae.gatech.edu&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ug_hmuwocnel6gz8yaqmx-4n3np6fuxkwwqwtvkpyni&s=nyq-z_wcigqlun2wxzmrg1uel0thlkn_kffesftfh6c&e= >. the institute for robotics and intelligent machines (irim) is one of the twelve interdisciplinary research institutes (iri) at georgia tech, and serves as an umbrella under which robotics researchers, educators, and students from across campus come together to advance the many high-powered and diverse robotics activities at georgia tech.  irim?s mission is to create new and exciting opportunities for faculty collaboration; educate the next generation of robotics experts, entrepreneurs, and academic leaders; and partner with industry and government to pursue truly transformative robotics research. more than 70 faculty, 30 labs and 60+ phd students across the college of engineering, the college of computing, the college of science, and the college of design are affiliated with irim. more details about irim can be found at robotics.gatech.edu<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics.gatech.edu&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ug_hmuwocnel6gz8yaqmx-4n3np6fuxkwwqwtvkpyni&s=1dupniqxub4luid6poxl4djdqqxkcmdjiblqzwcczjw&e= > applicants should send (electronically or via mail) a curriculum vitae, a cover letter, a statement of teaching interests and philosophy, a statement of research plans, and the name and contact information of at least three references to: michelle hall, c/o professor panagiotis tsiotras, search committee chair on autonomy, school of aerospace engineering, georgia institute of technology, atlanta, ga, 30332-0150. phone: (404) 385-3819, e-mail: michelle.hall at ae.gatech.edu<mailto:michelle.hall at ae.gatech.edu> **note**: interested candidates who will be attending icra 2017 in singapore and want to learn more about this and other hiring opportunities at irim, are welcome to attend the ?get to know irim? event on tuesday may 30th from 6-8pm at the casablanca conference room in the mice business centre on the level 3 of the sands expo and convention centre, which is located opposite the marina bay sands hotel. ----- panagiotis tsiotras college of engineering dean?s professor daniel guggenheim school of aerospace engineering associate director for research, institute for robotics and intelligent machines georgia institute of technology,  atlanta, ga 30332-0150, usa dcsl.gatech.edu<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dcsl.gatech.edu&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ug_hmuwocnel6gz8yaqmx-4n3np6fuxkwwqwtvkpyni&s=jcaqmiin1ewjtxoewylyzly6ohepynjqki_eehvn-j4&e= subject: principal perception scientist at  nutonomy - see you at icra?
content: dear colleagues: nutonomy is looking for senior people to work on perception, and in particular we are looking for a principal perception scientist. they will be a "guru" that can provide guidance on all things related to perception at nutonomy, both for product development as well as long-term strategic research. nutonomy's goal is to create fleets of provably safe autonomous vehicles. we believe that our goal requires a principled approach to perception, and in particular to the interaction between planning and perception, with the goal of creating a system that has both clearly-defined guarantees and an efficient implementation. therefore, we wish to find a person with broad interests who can coordinate a large team of perception specialists, and also contribute to the design of a complex architecture that integrates perception with planning, prediction, control, etc., under resource constraints. if interested, please get in touch with us to arrange a meeting during icra. singapore is one of our main offices, where our largest fleet resides, and we would be happy to show interested candidates around our facilities. the following is a link to the job posting. please note that for senior candidates we can tailor title and responsibilities according to the candidate's interests. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__nutonomy.com_jobs-3fgh-5fjid-3d467654&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=e4hnmzhzfoothf7bw_sm2ouk5vvmyuff8zsdjnfma_e&s=bqqtltiancopcb9oipphqc5nvtcuc-ujnyoaqq8xbgg&e=  (also note that we are also hiring in everything else!)

subject: multiple positions at cri group, ntu,  singapore: let's meet up at icra!
content: dear colleagues, cri group (www.ntu.edu.sg/home/cuong) is a young and dynamic robotics research team at ntu, singapore. we are always targeting the best venues in robotics (ijrr, ieee transactions on robotics, icra, rss, etc.) for publishing our research, and also have exciting commercialization opportunities. we currently have several job openings at different levels (phd student, post-doc, engineer) in the following broad fields: motion planning, control, robot vision, learning, system integration. interested candidates are invited to send a cv and their most significant publications and/or software projects (e.g. github repo) to cuong at ntu.edu.sg if you are attending icra 2017 in singapore, don't hesitate to drop me an email to arrange a meeting during the conference! looking forward to hearing from you! cuong --  quang-cuong pham www.normalesup.org/~pham www.ntu.edu.sg/home/cuong

subject: multiple positions at london startup  slamcore - meet us at icra 2017
content: our new imperial college london spinout slamcore is now fully up and running and we have job opportunities for outstanding research engineers in computer vision and slam, real-time software engineers and interns to work closely with the co-founder team. we are visual slam algorithm pioneers and specialists aiming to deliver breakthrough low power solutions for the next generation of spatially aware devices by harnessing sensor fusion and the latest developments in cameras and processors. please see our website linked below for full details.? https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.slamcore.com_job-2dopportunities&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gwtrtshlb1wdoh5ivkhu85hgdhvmso9mhcm4hhgmp4m&s=smcq7sgqkawdqeet54chbs02wapjtywff0f0lnfsjws&e=  our team will be attending icra in singapore, please contact us if you are interested and would like to arrange a meeting there. hanme kim co-founder | director slamcore limited www.slamcore.com

subject: multiple faculty positions for at the  institute of robotics, nankai university, see you at icra?
content: hi all,   multiple faculty positions (assistant/associate/professor) in the institute of robotics and automatic information system, college of computer and control engineering, nankai university, tianjin, china.    our department is expanding and there are multiple positions available in the fields of robotics including but not limited to 1.         perception, planning and control of robots or mechatronic systems. 2.         industrial robots, mobile and flying robots, underactuated systems, micro/nano-manipulation robots, rehabilitation and assistive robots, medical robots, bio-inspired robots, robot simulation and virtual reality, etc. 3.         human-robot interaction and collaboration.  the applications are open throughout the year.     the salaries and welfare are highly competitive and we can help you apply various talent programs such as ?national thousand young talents program?, ?tianjin thousand young talents program?, ?hundred young academic leaders program of nankai university?, and so on. please see the following website: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__nankai.en.school.cucas.cn_en_article_detail-3fcid-3d53&d=dwifbw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=corho9u3baitjhcf-moteimfa3322t2_jnhdkov7mda&s=axxfenkoaxodym17whzf6gneodfwq8j_ma_uygjyobk&e=  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__nankai.en.school.cucas.cn_en_article_detail-3fcid-3d53-26pid-3d53-26spid-3d6-26detail-3d270&d=dwifbw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=corho9u3baitjhcf-moteimfa3322t2_jnhdkov7mda&s=ssydjk9l8cfw8nyjozl1huuac7gtyppr_rbunpw3z5g&e= > &pid=53&spid=6&detail=270    qualifications:  - ph.d. degree (completed or about to be completed) in robotics, mechatronics, automatic control, or related areas.  - publications in refereed scientific journals and conference proceedings.  - strong research potential and excellent teaching capabilities.   if interested, please send applications by email to yongchun fang (vice dean of the college, email: fangyc at nankai.edu.cn) and xuebo zhang (zhangxuebo at nankai.edu.cn), in the form of a zip file containing the following documents (in pdf format):   - a curriculum vitae.    - research plan/proposal, with a maximum of three pages, excluding references.   - selected publications.  - two reference letters (can be sent by referees separately).   prof. yongchun fang will attend icra17 at singapore, interested applicants are very welcome to contact him via (fangyc at nankai.edu.cn) for a face-to-face discussion at the conference between may 30 and june 4.   welcome to join us and we would like to build a strong research team graduated from diverse (domestic and foreign) universities. for example, prof. yongchun fang himself received his ph. d degree from clemson university in 2002, with one year postdoc experience from 2002 to 2003 in cornell university. dr. ningbo yu (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.nyulab.org_&d=dwifbw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=corho9u3baitjhcf-moteimfa3322t2_jnhdkov7mda&s=o0v4abpwlbhpajegk63c19oncf7qspl9rhzo1cy9zkq&e= ) got his ph. d from eth zurich. dr. juanjuan zhang received his ph. d from carnegie mellon university (cmu), etc.   brief introduction of robotics research in nankai univ. in 1985, nankai cse(control science and engineering) initiated robotics research and established the artificial intelligence and robotics laboratory, listed as one of the earliest robotics laboratories in china. afterwards, nankai cse was certified s an open laboratory on robotics in the national high technology research and development program (863 program) of china in 1990, tianjin key laboratory of intelligent robotics in 2013, and national education center for virtual simulation in 2015. through decades of persistent academic pursuit, nankai cse has gained recognition for its diverse contributions. the research activities span from the large-scale aerospace down to micro/nano technologies, from industry robots to cell manipulation, from missile guidance to surgical navigation, etc. the first robot controller of china was developed in nankai, the micro-manipulation robotic system was awarded national award for technological invention, and commercialization has been successfully accomplished with several research achievements, such as an automated overhead crane system, a large-scale 3d sculpture-painting robot, etc.        2017/5/26   --------------------------- xuebo zhang (???) ph.d, associate professor/?????? institute of robotics and automatic information system (irais), deputy director /???????????????? tianjin key laboratory of intelligent robotics (tjklir) , deputy director / ??????????????????? nankai university, tianjin, p. r. china. /???? phone: +86-22-23505706-809 mobile: +86-1382 1963 019 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__cc.nankai.edu.cn_teachers_introduce.aspx-3ftid-3dzhangxb&d=dwifbw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=corho9u3baitjhcf-moteimfa3322t2_jnhdkov7mda&s=hi8vof9jkn0izlu740znbb2vijg6g2qe4gaje4gc2wi&e=  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.xuebozhang.net&d=dwifbw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=corho9u3baitjhcf-moteimfa3322t2_jnhdkov7mda&s=1jupoe82gurlevqgvhfuept4rgji3oyeba60oasil_i&e=

subject: softbank robotics' multiple openings  and possibility to meet at icra 2017, singapore, may 29 - june 2, 2017
content: dear colleagues, apologies for cross posting. exciting and exceptional opportunities for talented individuals to play prominent roles in one of the greatest robotics revolutions of the century! as pioneer, softbank robotics is leading the way towards bringing intelligent and social humanoid robots in different walks of life, for a smarter, healthier and happier living. softbank robotics europe (formerly aldebaran robotics) (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.ald&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vedm1qpzbt5vxgcas52e4bhctd90jx8lvtge2ivu0dw&s=ecssqkogg4twk5968fha_-jr0jdl7rmskcyikc13l9o&e= . softbankrobotics.com/en) has multiple openings for jobs and internships, including openings in its multi-disciplinary innovation department, which is responsible for long term r&d, in the fields of ai, hri, social robotics, mechatronics, perception, navigation, etc. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.facebook.com_softbankroboticseuropecareer&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vedm1qpzbt5vxgcas52e4bhctd90jx8lvtge2ivu0dw&s=wzodfxcjujs-rxnou_mkr1f0c30zkhxx1op_gyj5sw0&e=  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.ald.softbankrobotics.com_en_about-2dus_jobs_offers&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vedm1qpzbt5vxgcas52e4bhctd90jx8lvtge2ivu0dw&s=pdpei0jjigiidktxa7eaxabsz7fkmw79-ctl4x2vt94&e=  in addition, there are always exciting opportunities for deserving candidates. for more than 10 years, we have been driving technology into a new world by designing a range of humanoid robots (nao, pepper, and romeo, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.ald.softbankrobotics.com_en_node_1707&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vedm1qpzbt5vxgcas52e4bhctd90jx8lvtge2ivu0dw&s=wrzb5zwewzlzet-m1zb6wes3y4typd7o3sanbsrigpq&e= ) and their intelligence. offices in france, usa, china and japan, and more than 20000 robots being used in more than 70 countries, real users based feedback is one of the key drivers for our r&d and innovation. we are now taking the humanoid robotics revolution and business to the next level with no existing precedent, targeting b2b, b2a, b2d and b2c markets in various sectors including research, education, retail, healthcare, tourism, and entertainment. if you are a kind of individual (graduate, masters, phd, early stage researcher, senior researcher, ...), who is passionate about robotics and new technologies, cares about robotics research for the betterment of people and society, loves new challenges and wants to participate in an adventure out of the ordinary, then see us at icra 2017 ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.icra2017.org&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vedm1qpzbt5vxgcas52e4bhctd90jx8lvtge2ivu0dw&s=vig37dhh3gnr3bomfbd_eftbyoz7nh7wpskmywmiz24&e= ), from may 29 to june 2, 2017 at sands expo and convention centre, marina bay sands in singapore. to fix a meeting/discussion schedule during icra, please email me at: akpandey at softbankrobotics.com (amit kumar pandey) we will be happy to discuss and explore future possibilities based on mutual interest. see you. thanks & regards, amit kumar pandey ---- ========================= amit kumar pandey (ph.d.) head principal scientist (chief scientist) (r&d) scientific coordinator- collaborative projects (human robot interaction, socially intelligent robots, ai) softbank robotics (formerly aldebaran robotics) paris, france founding coordinator of eurobotics topic group on- socially intelligent robots and societal applications (siro-sa) https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__fr.linkedin.com_in_amitkrpandey&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vedm1qpzbt5vxgcas52e4bhctd90jx8lvtge2ivu0dw&s=-38mq4pzlnssc2ivfezf0rbw26-vddctktmqm57ucaq&e= subject: robotics jobs @ amazon core machine  learning, berlin -- meet me at icra'17
content: robotics jobs @ amazon core machine learning, berlin https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__amazon.jobs_ml-2drobotics&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=k_fhpvwdkxroj_vt0orovryqsgq80ch1x1jzku45t74&s=8afacduqyperwnkz0ob9se6hf0veo1xmekog2_lslmo&e=  amazon provides an enormously rich and interesting variety of robotics use cases. if you are enthusiastic about problem-driven robotics research, if you want your work to have massive impact on how robotics will change our world, amazon is the place to be for you. amazon has launched a new robotics team in berlin, focusing on machine learning and ai methods for robotics. the goals include generic robot manipulation, but also long-term strategic research towards robotic ai beyond factories. the team is part of the core machine learning team in berlin<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.amazon.jobs_en_teams_core-2dmachine-2dlearning&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=k_fhpvwdkxroj_vt0orovryqsgq80ch1x1jzku45t74&s=zzx-elu238edq1dd1_79m9n53lugbcmuy2wnrjwvd1u&e= >, which is a method development oriented lab with world-leading experts in the field. if you are interested, please contact me now at icra in singapore. amazon has a sponsor?s boot, and i will be around from wednesday on. for further information, please see: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__amazon.jobs_ml-2drobotics&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=k_fhpvwdkxroj_vt0orovryqsgq80ch1x1jzku45t74&s=8afacduqyperwnkz0ob9se6hf0veo1xmekog2_lslmo&e=  the concrete positions currently available in berlin are listed here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.amazon.jobs_en_search-3fbase-5fquery-3drobotics-26loc-5fquery-3d-26job-5fcount-3d2-26result-5flimit-3d10-26sort-3drelevant-26team-5fcategory-255b-255d-3dcore-2dmachine-2dlearning-26cache&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=k_fhpvwdkxroj_vt0orovryqsgq80ch1x1jzku45t74&s=nzbagojulxy9aesskj_i7tuadoyu0t3iqqysz45kyqg&e= subject: phd openings at iit in hyq robot  project (motion control and planning) [2nd call]
content: -------------------------------------------------------------------------- 2 open phd positions at iit in hydraulic robot motion control and planning -------------------------------------------------------------------------- the dynamic legged systems lab at the istituto italiano di tecnologia  (iit), an english language institute, is seeking to appoint 2  outstanding, highly-motivated phd students who will be involved in the  *hyq project* that aims to develop *versatile all-terrain legged  robots*. the positions are fully funded, start in november 2017 and  typically last 3 years. for more details on the topics and submission, visit https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__old.iit.it_advr-2ddls-2dopen-2dpositions.html&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lodoltfwerayeupdonwvx6jz0qtvk39gitphz2cj8o0&s=76vc4krsx1ctphamivrwgjyb3og-yw64gxgwdc6b4xs&e=  the hydraulic quadrupeds hyq and hyq2max are unique research platforms.  both are fully torque controlled hydraulic quadruped robots equipped  with inertial measurement units, laser range finders and stereo cameras.  since 2011 hyq has demonstrated a wide range of static and dynamic  motions such as a crawl gait, walking trot over flat, inclined and rough  terrain (indoors and outdoors), squat jumps, rearing, balancing under  disturbances and step reflexes: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_user_hydraulicquadruped&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lodoltfwerayeupdonwvx6jz0qtvk39gitphz2cj8o0&s=p4ky5ipkjh1shthajhxyzmvzcbflftuvrklzxtancqu&e=  -for more information: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_hyq&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lodoltfwerayeupdonwvx6jz0qtvk39gitphz2cj8o0&s=up-wozc-i4jjr4mctxd3ygy2ka6cvvkenkleq42ypwy&e=  -for news visit our facebook page: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.facebook.com_iitdlslab_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lodoltfwerayeupdonwvx6jz0qtvk39gitphz2cj8o0&s=zzqzjqdu2eev4nbfzi6eaagm55ecvzwmztr7uzamix8&e=  -or meet us during icra 2017 in singapore (please send me an email to  arrange a meeting). open phd themes: *theme 36:* locomotion planning and adaptation strategies for  multi-legged robotic platforms on soft terrains tutors: andreea r?dulescu, victor barasuol, claudio semini *theme 37:* force harvesting with short-term contacts for multi-legged  robot locomotion on movable and slippery terrain tutors: michele focchi, victor barasuol, claudio semini for a detailed description of the themes and instructions on how to  apply, visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__old.iit.it_advr-2ddls-2dopen-2dpositions.html&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lodoltfwerayeupdonwvx6jz0qtvk39gitphz2cj8o0&s=76vc4krsx1ctphamivrwgjyb3og-yw64gxgwdc6b4xs&e=  the application deadline is strictly june 13th, 2017 (noon, cest italian  time). best regards, claudio --  claudio semini, phd head of dynamic legged systems lab istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) advanced robotics department via morego 30, 16163 genoa, italy phone: +39 010 71781 912 email: claudio.semini at iit.it web: www.semini.ch or www.iit.it/people/claudio-semini.html

subject: phd opening in soft exoskeleton for  upper limb assistance/augmentation at nanyang technological university,  singapore
content: robotic exoskeletons have been developed for a large number of applications and now represent the new frontier in human augmentation and assistance. such technology is mainly devoted to assist in activities of daily living or rehabilitation for people who suffer from neurological impairments or spinal cord injuries.  exoskeletons have been extensively designed for walking assistance, with stationary systems, mounted over treadmill in hospitals and used to provide gait and retraining or rehabilitation. all these solutions are mainly focused on the lower limbs, while for the upper limb assistance at present few effective devices have been developed. the reason can be found in the complexity of the actions that a human arm/hand must perform, starting from a simple movement of the shoulder which involves multiple degrees of freedom, to complex manipulation of objects with the hands. that's why the existing technologies for upper limb rehabilitation are bulky systems, usually designed for mobilization of elbow and shoulder, and deployed in hospitals for constrained induced motion therapy.  the present project aims at designing a new concept of assistive devices based on soft materials. the use of the system will be mainly devoted to provide assistance to arm movement for elders or neurologically impaired subjects, lacking of capacity of motion and arm/hand dexterity. assisting individuals, able-bodied or patients with partial impairments poses particular challenges, especially when using robotic devices or exoskeletons. to work toward these goals, we propose a new paradigm in assistive device design, which we call soft clothing-like exosuits. these are devices that use textiles to interface with the body and apply joint torques via tensile forces over the outside of the body in parallel with the muscles, using the bone structure to support compressive loads.  the scope of the project is merging two main expertise in mechatronics and smart clothing design to develop a new wearable exoskeleton for human assistance. the exoskeleton (or exosuit) will be powered by a novel generation of actuators based on a tendon-driven transmission which will be integrated in the textiles and new sensing technology using carbon nanotubes to detect muscles activity and motion from the user.  the long goal is to create a portable wearable exosuit that assists or augments people with disabilities and lack of muscular control, by providing assistance and reducing metabolic expenditure when carrying or manipulating a load during activities of daily living.  the candidate will be enrolled in a vibrant and multidisciplinary environment and she/he will be asked to join the team working on the project by providing inputs and improvements in the design and characterization of the device, for both the engineering counterpart and the research related to smart wearable textiles.   *your profile*: we are looking for excellent applicants with a bachelor or master degree in mechanical engineering, robotics, computer science, applied mathematics, materials science or a related area of study, who are motivated to carry out internationally leading research.  knowledge in one or more of the following topics is mandatory: robotics and mechatronics, control design, computer-aided design (cad), computational structural mechanics, computational design, applied computing and applied artificial intelligence.  *what we are offering*: the phd positions are fully funded with a competitive salary (tuition fee is covered by ntu). you will be part of a highly motivated, international team at one of the most competitive universities in asia and in the world. besides working in our growing, ambitious team you will also have the chance to collaborate with numerous faculty, other labs and industrial partners co-funding the project.  intakes:  phd starting date august 2017 or january 2018.  application: please contact at first *asst prof lorenzo masia* for further info by email: lorenzo.masia at ntu.edu.sg -- view this message in context: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_robotics-2dworldwide-2djobs-2dphd-2dopening-2din-2dsoft-2dexoskeleton-2dfor-2dupper-2dlimb-2dassistance-2daugmentation-2dat-2dnae-2dtp5716715.html&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=obuv1p8kavqjf27jpfqwtp9fvc2lgy99v8i2m5znrcq&s=mxgutngincprbzxzjonzvu5uqfyubdf8tfdudllm0i0&e=  sent from the robotics-worldwide mailing list archive at nabble.com.

subject: various positions in aerial robotics  and embedded vision processing at national university of singapore
content: we have several positions available within our lab at national university singapore for post-docs, research assistant, and interns. please find the advertisement below, or the online version at this link www.garrickorchard.com/hiring <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.garrickorchard.com_hiring&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=z_t_1mif5dzxwcynikpryhzdqe7scbh6ekdl9orn8lo&s=ujgad4dgcmohouxdkrgez3vuozijpasuisgorbnmb8q&e=> best, garrick *post-doc and research assistant openings in embedded event-based processing:* we have several openings available at national university of singapore within temasek labs and the singapore institute for neurotechnology (sinapse). the lab focuses on bio-inspired sensing and computation. we leverage exciting technologies including silicon retina sensors and neural processors such as the spiking neural network architecture (spinnaker) and ibm's truenorth to build bio-inspired embedded sensory systems for autonomous aerial vehicles (quadcopters) and remote sensing applications. *post-doctoral research scientist* required qualifications:    - ph.d in electrical/computer engineering, computer science or similar    - strong programming skills    - record of publication    - good communication skills and ability to work in a team    - preference will be given to candidates with background in programming,    embedded hardware, computer vision, and neuromorphic engineering *research assistant* required qualifications:    - a degee in electrical/computer engineering, computer science or similar    - strong programming skills    - good communication skills and ability to work in a team    - preference will be given to candidates with bakground in programming,    embedded hardware, computer vision, and neuromorphic engineering how to apply interested applicants should contact garrickorchard at gmail.com with a cv for more information regarding the research programs and positions. positions will remain open until filled. only shortlisted applicants will be notified. --  garrick orchard senior research scientist, national university singapore, www.garrickorchard.com

subject: robotics software engineer @iim pte ltd  singapore
content: we are looking for robotics enthusiasts to join us to build smart robots and perception system that evolve around building facility management functions. this position is all about developing intelligent autonomous mobile agent for navigation and localization inside buildings and facilities. applicants should be well versed with current robot slam and navigation technologies. we welcome people that open to challenges of fast paced developments and willing to achieve the best results and prepared for events and presentations. the team consists of high talented engineers and researchers that focus to build up applications and products. we offer competitive benefits based on experiences. *required skills: * - bs or ms in computer science, robotics, or a related field. - knowledge of slam algorithm and navigation of mobile robots - experience deploying algorithms to the real robots - ability to translate ideas into practical code - high proficiency in c++ and python. - effective oral and written communication skills in english - have high interest in building and developing robots/autonomous agents *preferable skills: * - experience in linux operating system and its utilities and configurations - experience in creating computational efficient code - experience with robot operating system (ros) - experience with system debugging - communication in chinese is a plus we do have an office in shenzhen. candidates can choose to be stationed in singapore or shenzhen. more information about the job and how to apply can be found in here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.jobstreet.com.sg_en_job_robotic-2dengineer-2dslam-2d5894362&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hf3yhvyargih4wqjhn4curvro5m-6trv73rswdmunyu&s=r5ycamtju_jrrlf_-jjbllfknzfavjnka7ojp1yaflm&e=

subject: computer vision
content: transforma robotics is looking to hire a highly motivated and skilled computer vision engineer to join a multidisciplinary research and development team with diverse backgrounds. the role will primarily consist of the design and development of advanced robotic software for indoor scene reconstruction using 3d sensors (tof camera, lidar, visual sensor) and fast processing of 3d data (e.g. point clouds), as well as developing algorithms for 3d perception and advanced (visual and data) parsing of indoor architectural point clouds into their semantic features. it is relevant for the project to detect specific objects like multi-surfaces, intersection, corners, windows, pipes, etc. on the point cloud and the results should be classified to the ontology of objects and 3d layout/geometry of each object should be estimated as well. you will be part of the core r&d team and will be involved in the development, verification and integrated implementation of software in robot operating system (ros) for a task-oriented service robot. this is an excellent opportunity to get involved in a high-tech startup company, working to build the innovative construction service robots. the salary is competitive, and the successful candidate will be rewarded with an exciting role which has many opportunities for career progression. qualifications and desired skills:   *   m.s. or ph.d. degree in cs, ee, me or related fields   *   strong interest in computer vision,  robotics,  and robot vision   *   experience with depth/point-cloud data processing and 3d reconstruction is desired   *   experience in 3d perception (3d geometry)   *   expertise in one or more of the following areas: applying state-of-art machine learning algorithm, software system integration and testing, image processing, robot vision   *   strong proficiency in programming using c++, python and experience with linux   *   knowledge and experience working with libraries such as pcl and opnecv, as well as working with robot operating system (ros)   *   familiarity with deep learning neural network libraries and/or gpu programming would be an advantage. application procedure: interested candidates, please send your cv to easadi at transformarobotics.com and hr at transformarobotics.com. an interview will be conducted for each profile fitting the requirement. only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. for more information, you can contact professor chen i-ming, chair of robotics research center, ntu, and co-founder & ceo of transforma robotics: michen at transformarobotics.com. about transforma robotics: transforma robotics is a high-tech startup company at the forefront of new technologies and innovations in automating construction services:  a spin-off company from nanyang technological university (ntu) and well supported by ntuitive and government agencies such as the jurong town corporation (jtc corp), singapore. the company mission is to develop and integrate modular robotic platforms with artificial intelligence and data analytics to tackle real-life challenges of productivity and safety in the construction industry. we have a dynamic and highly educated team, and currently looking for more talented engineers to grow our team. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ehsan asadi (dr) | co-founder, director & principal scientist | transforma robotics innovation centre block 2, 18 nanyang drive,  #02-221, singapore 637723 tel | (65) 8575 7530 gmt+8hm, email | easadi at transformarobotics.com

subject: multiple scientist positions in robot  manipulation & hri @ a*star, singapore
content: the robotics department at the institute for infocomm research, a*star, singapore, invites applications for multiple research scientist positions in robot manipulation and hri. we offer highly competitive remuneration, leave and welfare package which commensurate with the experience of each applicant. details on each position can be found below. applications will be reviewed until the positions are filled. interested applicants are requested to submit: * a cover letter * a curriculum vitae that includes the name, address and email of 2 referees to wuy  (at) i2r.a-star.edu.sg as soon as possible. shortlisted candidates will be notified through email for interview. position 1: scientist (compliant human-robot collaboration) ============================================================================ job description you will be involved in some or all of the following tasks: - research and development of a task-based approach for robot to learn collaborative skills, such as object hand-over and human-robot co-manipulation of environment based on multimodal sensory information. - system integration to deliver functioning modules on a humanoid robot or a mobile manipulator. - actively collaborate with other researchers in testing, experimentations, and trouble-shootings the robots during testing and real-world trial deployments - closely collaborate with other researchers to conduct research on multimodal perception, affordance understanding and dual arm manipulation - realization of algorithms developed into computational footprints that are suitable for deployment in robots, including optimizing the algorithms to allow for real time processing or deployment in an embedded processor job requirements - phd in computer science or electrical, electronics, computer, mechanical or mechatronics engineering - possess background in relevant robotics field - proficient in programming skills (c/c++ and/or python) - possess good analytical skills, innovative and proven track record in solving problems encountered in projects that are relevant to robotics - possess good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills - experience with ros and/or yarp is an advantage position 2: scientist (motor skills learning and dexterous manipulation) ============================================================================ job description you will be involved in some or all of the following tasks: - research and development of new multimodal learning and control algorithms for grasping and manipulating objects and surfaces, yet safe to interact with human with force/tactile sensing fused with other sensor modalities. - system integration to deliver functioning modules on a humanoid robot or a mobile manipulator. - actively collaborate with other researchers in testing, experimentations, and trouble-shootings the robots during testing and real-world trial deployments - closely collaborate with other researchers to conduct research on robotic affordance understanding, grasping and perception, including tactile perception technology to create new robotic capabilities - realization of algorithms developed into computational footprints that are suitable for deployment in robots, including optimizing the algorithms to allow for real time processing or deployment in an embedded processor job requirements - phd in computer science or electrical, electronics, computer, mechanical or mechatronics engineering - possess background in relevant robotics field - proficient in programming skills (c/c++ and/or python) - possess good analytical skills, innovative and proven track record in solving problems encountered in projects that are relevant to robotics - possess good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills - experience with ros and/or yarp is an advantage position 3: scientist (mobile manipulation) =========================================================================== job description you will be involved in some or all of the following tasks: - research and development on mobile manipulation and whole-body control - research and development of visual guided robot control for manipulation and navigation - realization of algorithms developed above into computational footprints that are suitable for deployment in robots including consideration of processing power and speed on an embedded processor, use of computationally efficient algorithms etc - actively collaborate with other researchers to solve any technical issues that arise when deploying the algorithms in real world scenarios job requirements - phd in computer science/information technology, science & technology or related fields; - possess relevant work experience in both control and image processing/computer vision - proficient in programming skill in these languages (c/c++, python & matlab); - possess good publication track records as evidence of research capability and innovative problem solving skills - possess good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills - experience with ros and/or yarp is an advantage about us ================ the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) is singapore's lead public sector agency that fosters world-class scientific research and talent to drive economic growth and transform singapore into a vibrant knowledge-based and innovation driven economy.  for more information about a*star, please visit: www.a-star.edu.sg<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.a-2dstar.edu.sg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ijtioyl0eg2n6ddnhuu73wag1dxj-0nd0pi1dyhef50&s=2erybsgh5om74jyskx2bk7gqydpk4qzq7rzet0e37cg&e= > the institute for infocomm research (i?r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore's largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg best wishes, yan this e-mail and any attachments are only for the use of the intended recipient and may contain material that is confidential, privileged and/or protected by the official secrets act. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it or notify the sender immediately. please do not copy or use it for any purpose or disclose the contents to any other person.

subject: rris' research positions - 2017
content: dear all, rris (rehabilitation research institute of singapore) is a research institute in ntu (nanyang technological university, singapore) that is established under the collaboration between ntu, nhg (national healthcare group) and a*star (agency for science, technology and research). rris aims to achieve research excellence in and push the boundary of rehabilitation science and technology.?  we are looking for highly motivated and independent researchers with a keen interest in rehabilitation research to join us for the following positions.  interested candidates may send their cv, list of publications, statement of research interests and names of three references to rris.enquiry at ntu.edu.sg 1- research fellow (rehabilitation / assistive robotics)  responsibilities . to leads rris in-house research and technology development. . to lead and manage research activities including conducting trials, design and development of prototypes. . to publish papers in top journals and top tier conferences. . to prepare research proposals. . to apply human factors engineering principles to the user-centred design, development, and evaluation of assistive and rehabilitation devices will be greatly advantageous. requirements . phd degree in engineering, computer science or related field preferred. 2- research fellow (science / engineering)  responsibilities . to design experimental trial protocols to study various human activities used in assessment of patients receiving physiotherapy and occupational therapy. . to explore and establish collaborations with local and overseas institutions on multi-centres data collection and sharing. requirements . phd degree from any discipline in science or engineering with a strong rehabilitation research background. . familiarity with current clinical therapy assessment methods will be highly beneficial. 3- research fellow (physiotherapist)  responsibilities . to publish papers in top journals and top tier conferences. . to prepare research proposals. . to lead and manage research activities including conducting trials, design of experiments and applying for ethics approval. requirements . phd degree in physiotherapy or related field preferred. . a valid physiotherapy license to handle patients will be greatly advantageous. thanks! regards, mohammad mohammad esmaeili, phd | manager (technology) | rehabilitation research institute of singapore (rris) | nanyang technological university | n3-02c-111, 50 nanyang avenue, singapore 639798  tel: (65) 6790 6098 gmt+8h | fax: (65) 6792 4062 | email: esmaeili at ntu.edu.sg | web: subject: aitech robotics & automation is looking  for industrial autonomous vechicle software engineer & senior eletrical  engineer
content: aitech robotics and automation pte ltd is a dynamic and fast-paced robotics company for industrial autonomous vehicles based in a singapore. ------------------------------------------------------------------ current job openings ------------------------------------------------------------------ autonomous vechicle software engineer senior eletrical engineer ------------------------------------------------------------------ autonomous vechicle software engineer ------------------------------------------------------------------ responsibilities - research & develop autonomous technologies for industrial autonomous vehicles - perform algorithm development, architecture design, and software development - apply extensive knowledge of programming languages, modeling, simulation, and robotics-related algorithms, including autonomous navigation, mapping and localization requirements - degree or above in eletrical engineering, computer science, robotics or mechatronics - 3+ or more years of experience with c++ programming(or python) and familar with software engineering tools (e.g., git, cmake, gdb, etc.) - practical experience in implementing localization, mapping, path planning, avoidance algorithms  or control systems - experience with tricycle or ackermann drive - experience with modeling and simulation through gazebo or similar physics?based simulators - experience with linux environment and ros - great enthusiasm for robotics and able to work independently in a colleborative environment - highly motivated, proactive attitude and great communication skills - ability to thrive in a small multidisciplinary group and collaborate with international colleagues - willing to relocate to singapore - fluency in english ------------------------------------------------------------------ senior eletrical engineer ------------------------------------------------------------------ responsibilities - designing eletrical & electronic systems for industrial autonomous vechicle - develop electronic circuits to perform functions per requirements including circuit design, schematic capture, and board layout - generate electrical documentation (schematics, boms, test plans) - develop prototype circuit boards for verification of design and software development - verify functionality of prototype boards, address issues as found - board bring-up and debugging - management of suppliers during specification, design, and build of systems requirements - bachelor?s or above in electrical or electronic engineering - 3+ or more years or more of practical industry experience - experience with electrical circuit and pcb design - experience with operating and developing code for embedded or singleboard computers - experience with developing software and architectures for secure data links and communications - demonstrated ability in analog and digital system design - familiar with automotive can bus system - proficiency with laboratory debugging tools - highly motivated, proactive attitude and great communication skills - ability to thrive in a small multidisciplinary group and collaborate with international colleagues - willing to relocate to singapore - fluency in english to explore the post further or for any queries, please email at: jacky-tan at aitech-robotics.com tel: +65 81890882

subject: multiple scientist/engineer positions  in robotics and driverless car @ a*star, singapore
content: the robotics department at the institute for infocomm research, a*star, singapore, invites applications for multiple research scientist/engineer positions in driverless car and robotics. we offer highly competitive remuneration, leave and welfare package which is commensurate with the experience of each applicant. details on each position can be found below. applications will be reviewed until the positions are filled. interested applicants are requested to submit: * a cover letter * a curriculum vitae that includes the name, address and email of 2 referees to wuy  (at) i2r.a-star.edu.sg as soon as possible. shortlisted candidates will be notified through email for interview. position 1/2: scientist/engineer (driverless car) ============================================================================ job description the department developed its first driverless car and was successful tested in singapore at the one north testbed in 2015. due to the popularity of this research area, we are seeking candidates with passion to conduct r&d in this new and exciting area. you will be part of our team developing intelligent system for autonomous vehicle (av). specifically, the focus will be on enhancing the av to be able to have smooth driving capability in singapore's crowded urban traffic, weather and environmental conditions. research challenges of interest to us includes but are not limited to: - multi-modal fusion combining lidar and vision for robust localization and perception, including under adverse weather condition - deep learning based solution for robust object detection and understanding, including pedestrians, bicyclists and motorcyclists, and to provide fast response while maintaining low error rate. - understanding the threat level to the av's movement for the objects detected in the surrounding - navigation behaviour of the av given uncertainties associated to the location and detected objects in the surrounding - specific behaviour of the av such as moving and parking at tight spots, roundabouts, traffic jams etc. - robust system integration with failure recovery - automated reliability testing - new sensors suitable for av - specific behaviour of the av such as moving and parking at tight spots, roundabouts, traffic jams etc. - specific focus of the scientist position is in multi-modal perception fusion to achieve robust perception for av navigation. - specific focus of the engineer position is in development and implementation of faster inference using deep learning on multi-modal perception fusion and other results to control the av. you are also expected to assist in data collection, testing and integration into the our av platform and extending to other platforms, as well as software verification and reliability testing. job requirements - phd (for scientist position) / masters in robotics/computer engineering/computer science or related fields - experience in robotics, av, deep learning, robotic vision or related areas will be useful. - fresh graduates are welcome to apply. - strong software development skills in c/c++, python; - good knowledge on ros, linux and/or dds related middleware; - experience with tensor flow, theano, caffe, or other deep learning tools - good knowledge/experience in system software-hardware integration - track record in delivering innovative projects successfully - able to work independently, yet possesses strong teamwork ethics  with good interpersonal position 3: scientist (compliant human-robot collaboration) ============================================================================ job description you will be involved in some or all of the following tasks: - research and development of a task-based approach for robot to learn collaborative skills, such as object hand-over and human-robot co-manipulation of environment based on multimodal sensory information. - system integration to deliver functioning modules on a humanoid robot or a mobile manipulator. - actively collaborate with other researchers in testing, experimentations, and trouble-shootings the robots during testing and real-world trial deployments - closely collaborate with other researchers to conduct research on multimodal perception, affordance understanding and dual arm manipulation - realization of algorithms developed into computational footprints that are suitable for deployment in robots, including optimizing the algorithms to allow for real time processing or deployment in an embedded processor job requirements - phd in computer science or electrical, electronics, computer, mechanical or mechatronics engineering - possess background in relevant robotics field - proficient in programming skills (c/c++ and/or python) - possess good analytical skills, innovative and proven track record in solving problems encountered in projects that are relevant to robotics - possess good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills - experience with ros and/or yarp is an advantage position 4: scientist (motor skills learning and dexterous manipulation) ============================================================================ job description you will be involved in some or all of the following tasks: - research and development of new multimodal learning and control algorithms for grasping and manipulating objects and surfaces, yet safe to interact with human with force/tactile sensing fused with other sensor modalities. - system integration to deliver functioning modules on a humanoid robot or a mobile manipulator. - actively collaborate with other researchers in testing, experimentations, and trouble-shootings the robots during testing and real-world trial deployments - closely collaborate with other researchers to conduct research on robotic affordance understanding, grasping and perception, including tactile perception technology to create new robotic capabilities - realization of algorithms developed into computational footprints that are suitable for deployment in robots, including optimizing the algorithms to allow for real time processing or deployment in an embedded processor job requirements - phd in computer science or electrical, electronics, computer, mechanical or mechatronics engineering - possess background in relevant robotics field - proficient in programming skills (c/c++ and/or python) - possess good analytical skills, innovative and proven track record in solving problems encountered in projects that are relevant to robotics - possess good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills - experience with ros and/or yarp is an advantage about us ================ the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) is singapore's lead public sector agency that fosters world-class scientific research and talent to drive economic growth and transform singapore into a vibrant knowledge-based and innovation driven economy.  for more information about a*star, please visit: www.a-star.edu.sg<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.a-2dstar.edu.sg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vhtcusvmnasw9xjictflxjcxjwow0qiif8wglhrci1q&s=fvzy1ogscnqoursortaif_yvh3dnwvf7ifjt3iw_uvs&e=> the institute for infocomm research (i??r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore's largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.i2r.a-2dstar.edu.sg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vhtcusvmnasw9xjictflxjcxjwow0qiif8wglhrci1q&s=quamwzgomexafxvm1zzpspcp1pwz_wmhipkpz-1iiyk&e=> best wishes, yan this e-mail and any attachments are only for the use of the intended recipient and may contain material that is confidential, privileged and/or protected by the official secrets act. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it or notify the sender immediately. please do not copy or use it for any purpose or disclose the contents to any other person.

subject: a research fellow position in  autonomous mobile robotics at nanyang technological university, singapore
content: the st engineering - ntu corporate lab (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ste-2dntulab.ntu.edu.sg_pages_home.aspx&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=c4ngqnrly2_0kylmeunwnvlcqfny-oiwd8rnfyswtcc&s=hwcj7sfymk_amhp6nu--pozd-_fxxf2d3cwkwm2f1og&e=) is looking for a highly motivated skilled robotics researcher to join a research project aimed at developing autonomous air and ground robots for search and mapping missions. the successful candidate will work with prof. danwei wang (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__goo.gl_ujjb9u&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=c4ngqnrly2_0kylmeunwnvlcqfny-oiwd8rnfyswtcc&s=hzwsge3owlfiboq8stjtfsd9hjdr0srzq4jc6jupbjg&e=) and a group of research fellows, research associates and phd/masters students at nanyang technological university, singapore. the successful applicant will be mainly responsible for   *   improving existing/developing new 3d exploration algorithms   *   translate novel and existing research outcomes on planning for autonomous 3d mapping to real robot systems (both air and ground)   *   leading efforts to make both air and ground robots navigate autonomously in semi-structured/unstructure environments the applicant must   *   have a ph.d in a related field of research   *   have demonstrated research and engineering skills in at least one of the following areas - 3d perception and mapping, motion planning, control, computer vision for robotics, ai for robotics   *   be comfortable with software development for robotic systems and genuinely excited about validating research results in field experiments using real robotic systems preference will be given to applicants with the following additional skills   *   extensive c/c++/python skills   *   experience in robotic software development using ros   *   experience with standard open-source robotics related software libraries   *   hands on experience with implementing/deploying algorithms on actual robotic systems and conducing field experiments   *   good verbal and written communication skills in english initial contract is for one year with a possibility of extension based on performance. an attractive remuneration based on the experiences and qualifications and a standard benefit package competitive with the industry will be provided for the successful applicant. interested candidates please send your cv/resume to prof. danwei wang (edwwang at ntu.edu.sg)

content: dear all, we would like to call for application for postdoctoral fellow & research engineer positions at the singapore university of technology and design (sutd). the successful applicant will have to opportunity to work on a project relating human-machine interfaces to control multiple robotic platforms. preference will be given to those with prior experience in: - debian - node.js - mongodb - angularjs - c# & c++ - android qualification: - relevant degree in electrical engineering, , mechanical engineering, robotics, or related areas - strong hands on experience applications, assembled as a single pdf file, should contain a complete resume, full list of publications, as well as the names and contact information of up to three references. interested applicants may send his/her cv to asst prof u-xuan tan via email ( uxuan_tan at sutd.edu.sg ). review of applications will continue until the positions are filled.  only shortlisted candidates will be notified. regards, u-xuan tan, phd assistant professor, engineering product development (epd) singapore university of technology and design (sutd) 8 somapah road, singapore 487372 email: uxuan_tan at sutd.edu.sg did: +65 6499 4524 website: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__people.sutd.edu.sg_-7euxuan-5ftan_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=6iyaof3lrbtuco1-c_xkeh0buqe_btme4fxjogl_ltq&s=2fla7chjlpdjamwrmb2sf0q4-zroexm8_ekfumrvbse&e= this email may contain confidential and/or proprietary information that is exempt from disclosure under applicable law and is intended for receipt and use solely by the addressee(s) named above. if you are not the intended recipient, you are notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this email, or any attachment, is strictly prohibited. please delete the email immediately and inform the sender. thank you

content: research fellow job description the institute for media innovation (imi https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__imi.ntu.edu.sg_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=i7ulm4aoeugiozbverapqwlu5szbyudhrtqowj4gcug&s=bzhgd_gcz_9whzevevjxpchljz8q5w5tbynnijoa0lu&e= ) at nanyang technological university, singapore, immediately invites applications for outstanding researchers to work in our leading research media institute (imi) in singapore, in the area of social robots. researchers will have an opportunity to work in a cutting-edge interactive environment with top equipment including very realistic human-like robots and several other small size robots. job requirements the candidate should hold a phd degree from a reputed university in robotics, ai, machine learning or computer science. the applicant must have experience in one of the following topics as evidenced by publications in high level journals and conferences: ? curriculum vitae with photo ? two names and contacts of referees ? salary expectation ? availability date review of applicants will begin immediately and continue until the positions are filled. ntu offers a vibrant multidisciplinary research environment, with both students and faculty members enjoying a host of opportunities for research collaboration with world-leading universities and renowned institutes. there is a strong research culture where innovation and critical enquiry are key features. ntu researchers are immersed in the best of work environment. ?we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: vacancy for one postdoctoral research  fellow with background in control and dynamics
content: *a postdoctoral research fellow position is available in nanyang technological university* *job description:* a postdoctoral research fellow with a background in control and dynamics (of automobiles preferably) for a project aimed at fault and attack detection in critical sensors and systems of an autonomous car is required. the successful candidate will work with professor danwei wang and a group of research fellows, research associates and phd/masters/bachelors students in the school of eee at nanyang technological university, singapore.  *major responsibilities include* ?	design and development of methodology and architecture for detection of malicious intrusion and malfunctions of safety and critical sensors, actuators and control systems of autonomous vehicles. ?	filter design (e.g. kalman filter) for sensor fusion with application to failure detection. *the applicant must* ?	have completed/near completion of his/her ph.d in electrical engineering, control engineering, signal processing or other related fields ?	be willing to collaborate with other team members and help and guide junior researchers on a regular basis ?	be comfortable with software development for mobile robotic systems/autonomous vehicles or be comfortable to learn the respective software systems ?	have good verbal and written communication skills in english *preference will be given to applicants with following additional skills and experiences:* ?	extensive c/c++/ python/matlab programming skills ?	familiar with ros programming terminology ?	experience of working with mobile robotic sensors and systems *application procedure:* interested candidates please email your cv/resume together with a cover letter to:  /professor danwei wang:  edwwang at ntu.edu.sg/   initial contract is for one year with a possibility of extension up to a maximum of two years. an attractive remuneration based on the experiences and qualifications and a standard benefit package competitive with the industry will be provided for the successful applicant. only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview. *about ntu/eee:* established in 1981, the school of electrical and electronic engineering (eee) is one of the founding schools of the nanyang technological university. built on a culture of excellence, the school is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research. to support teaching and cutting-edge research, eee is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories, which are well-equipped with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. with about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,300 are graduate students, it is one of the largest eee schools in the world. -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hs8crnbkrgx5t6mjjf7x7rzd9acxfbkofbhruvctras&s=llec5ida87ed_7mdxhrhjc9bvuvyna_1nlwitkpnzaw&e=

subject: software engineer
content: iim pte ltd is a well-funded robotics company working on making intelligent service robots for smart facility management of commercial and residential buildings. these include: turnstile access control robot, door access control robot, registration machine, and patrolling robot. all our robots function together to make the building and access control safer, more convenient and more intelligent. we are expert in deep learning technology and applied in facial recognition. in 2015, we opened our new research and development center in singapore to leverage on the big pool of local talents that the country is well known for. our partners in singapore include capitaland and imda. at iim, we aim to be a partner in every stage of the growth of our clients. we believe in professionalism and integrity through proper conduct and quality of our work. thus we strive to attract and retain qualified and dedicated professionals. we welcome enthusiastic and dedicated individuals to join us as *software engineer.* *role:* improve the robustness of software project, logger analysis and trouble-shooting help build scalable programs that standardize information flow and increase operational capacity be part of a close-knit engineering team ships new code every day *requirements:* degree information technology or computer engineering good programming skill in c/c++ enthusiasm with writing and improving code ability to learn new libraries through their documentations experience in object-oriented programming knowledgeable about linux, git, python and ros good communication skills with teams *what you?ll get:* the opportunity to define engineering culture on a small team of less than 20 meaningful equity in a fast growing startup product ownership ? take autonomy over core products & product features sharp, motivated co-workers in a fun office environment working location: singapore salary: s$4000 to s$8000 application materials should be sent via e-mail to: *xene.chua at iim.ltd* -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kq80jawy9yi464crpln5spjmymbbbemqrvuc4eoxmgq&s=6m46zntpl7iw9zihfwzn0sarqqcfkmallac4lozd0a0&e=
