subject: ros-industrial consortium -  opportunities in usa and singapore (min ling chan)
content: the ros-industrial consortiums is looking for enthusiastic and motivated candidates to join in working on industrial applications with the ros-industrial consortium in usa (swri, texas) and singapore (artc). usa - swri analyst - research analyst - industrial robotics job code: 10-00981 job summary: we are expanding our team working on leading technologies in industrial robotics and are looking for talented and motivated candidates to join us. qualified candidates have the opportunity to work in a flexible and stimulating environment on diverse technical challenges in applied research and development. job responsibilities will include: conceive, develop and deploy robotic and automation software solutions for advanced manufacturing applications and perception-driven solutions; design, build, debug and implement robotic and automation solutions; develop and test advanced software solutions for manufacturing and industrial processes and technologies; assist in preparing proposals and cost estimates; interact with customers to promote new business and develop technical requirements; participate on and lead technical project tasks; document and report technical work; perform other duties as assigned. education/experience: bs, ms, or phd in robotics or computer science with at least a 3.5 gpa and 0 - 5 years of robotics and related software development experience. must have experience with developing software and controls for robotics and automation. beneficial skills include: c++ and python software development, ros (robot operating system), opencv, pcl (point cloud library), linux. beneficial knowledge includes: industrial robotics, mobile robotics, 2d/3d computer vision, path planning for robotics and robot manipulation, machine learning, optimization, perception/sensing for robot guidance, localization. travel on an as needed basis to customer sites and conference locations. a valid/clear driver's license is required. special considerations: applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. applicant must be a u.s. citizen. for more information please visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__resapp.swri.org_resapp_job-5fsearch-5fresults.aspx-3fdetail-3d10-2d00981&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=itql23ngbbeaedthqc2on9fvu_d-yfjycq1mo3j3k_y&s=dz1mdd5weyalbdzif9q6d2fndqt6k_tu1xydxrjov8y&e= ** singapore - artc ** [x] job description - software engineer (robotic software development) [x] develop, extend, support and apply robotics software to solve industrial problems. ability to use the ros programming framework and gazebo simulator. topics of interest include 3d modelling, communications middleware, developer and debugging tools, perception, motion planning, and software packaging and distribution. the ideal candidate is proficient in at least one of these topics, and capable of expanding into others. responsibilities: * create software architecture, design and evaluate technologies to use * design, analyze, troubleshooting and debugging systems and develop software solutions for industry members by translating business requirements into system requirements * software development in c++, python tools and libraries * full life-cycle library and application development. * support, maintenance, and documentation of software functionality. * software testing and quality assurance. * integrate software with robotic hardware and mechanics to automate the adaptive robotic process * develop testing and validation strategies * manage state of the art machine vision technology and integration with robotic processes * technical project planning and execution on development projects for global industry members * technical write up and presentation [x] job requirements [x] * bs, ms or phd in computer science, engineering or relevant discipline * min 2 years programming / software development experience (gui, drivers, linux-based development) * experience using ros, c, c++ and the oo paradigm (under linux), python, java tools and libraries * extensive knowledge of software development in linux * experience in designing and developing large software systems. for more information please visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.jobstreet.com.sg_en_job_6148185_sources_1&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=itql23ngbbeaedthqc2on9fvu_d-yfjycq1mo3j3k_y&s=wpjmczvgnvhia2p1g1esihfdqfbcogoke1ukxqhwo3o&e= thank you, best regards, ms min ling chan :: program manager :: ros-industrial asia pacific consortium 3 cleantech loop, #01-01, cleantech two :: singapore 637143 :: tel. (65) 6715 8796 :: hp (65) 8139 7897 :: fax. (65) 6908 7921 :: rosindustrial.org<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__rosindustrial.org_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=itql23ngbbeaedthqc2on9fvu_d-yfjycq1mo3j3k_y&s=kuo7ctqfwut5otc5y70zkl8pb9ds_j2xuzsil1banea&e=> this e-mail and any attachments are only for the use of the intended recipient and may contain material that is confidential, privileged and/or protected by the official secrets act. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it or notify the sender immediately. please do not copy or use it for any purpose or disclose the contents to any other person.

subject: chief of robotics development / senior  technical lead
content: advanced remanufacturing and technology centre ________________________________________ the advanced remanufacturing and technology centre (artc) is a new industry-led centre by the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) in collaboration with nanyang technological university (ntu). based on a contemporary business model of public-private partnership, the centre transforms remanufacturing and manufacturing research into industry ready solutions for cross-sectoral industry members by bringing together best-in-class global companies and r&d minds in singapore. currently, the artc works with 48 industry members to develop advanced remanufacturing and manufacturing capabilities. the members are comprised of global mncs, leading equipment and software providers as well as smes. at artc, you will have a unique opportunity to unleash your creativity and competencies to develop innovative solutions for industry members. spanning across our key technical areas in repair & restoration, surface enhancement, product verification, robotics process development, additive manufacturing (3d printing) and smart manufacturing. you will help industry members to realize the full potential of remanufacturing possibilities, from process development to integrated systems and solutions. in addition, you will support industry members to develop strategies and technology roadmaps in advanced remanufacturing. you will also be part of an exciting advanced remanufacturing network, developing world-class knowledge in the field of advanced remanufacturing. for more information about artc, please visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.a-2dstar.edu.sg_artc&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wf5k8hzhckrmbzltq_vzcv7mkqbpgof4anbm6y2wxcm&s=i_rzqx032-6ns689v1rb9okx4kez24h2emyrhgouthq&e= ________________________________________ job description  ________________________________________ reporting to and working closely with the group manager, to plan & drive the technology development & research direction for the advanced robotic applications group. as a subject matter expert, he/she will also be mentoring junior engineers or scientist to deliver important kpis that are aligned to artc strategic goals. the successful candidate will be responsible for delivering key projects and ensure relevance to the manufacturing industry. specific responsibilities are: ?	develop group technology roadmap of robotic capabilities, for manufacturing process and ensure it is align to market trends and customer requirements.  ?	drive personal and team?s r&d effort in robotic process technology development for manufacturing applications ?	mentor the staff in design, analyze, troubleshoot and debugging systems and develop automation solutions using robots, for industry partners ?	propose and develop team?s r&d direction and ensure it is align to market trends, customer requirements and artc strategic directions.  ?	lead & motivate a team of engineers for key projects delivery. it will include in-house, collaborative (with university and a*star institutes) and direct-industry projects.  ?	manage and plan technical training & career growth for engineer and scientist to meet group?s key performance indicators.  ?	responsible for delivering group?s kpi in terms of knowledge creation, technology transfer, publications and intellectual property.  ________________________________________ job requirements  ________________________________________ ?	minimum 12 years of experience in manufacturing technology development (at least 4-6 years of experience in r&d)  especially in the area of automation and robotic technology, with extensive knowledge in integrating software & hardware to develop robotic applications for manufacturing process ?	possess broad knowledge in developing software architecture, design and evaluate technologies for robotic systems with industry standards  ?	significant experience in programming / software development (gui, drivers, linux-based development) ?	minimum 3-4 years of work experience in control system for industrial automation & tools like image processing, machine vision etc.  ?	good experience in translating business requirements from manufacturing industry into system requirements for automation process ?	possess broad knowledge in using lean tools such as dmaic or pfmea etc and use this knowledge to facilitate technical discussion and derive appropriate methodology.  ?	proven track record of success in leadership positions ?	capable in customer engagement and advice key customers on technical risk, alternatives or solutions.  ?	proven experience in leading and mentoring engineers or scientist to deliver r&d projects for internal or external customers.  ?	proven experience in leading integrated project teams and possess track record in delivering technology solutions to improve productivity.  ?	able to make effective and persuasive presentations on complex topics to staff, customers, top management and public groups. how to apply: ?	email your detailed resume to hr at artc.a-star.edu.sg. ?	kindly indicate the position you are applying for in the subject header ?	we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified ?	the above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. a*star may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. these policies may be amended from time to time without notice. -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wf5k8hzhckrmbzltq_vzcv7mkqbpgof4anbm6y2wxcm&s=13lu2pnpkh7ozctwcnbiphyay5mjp_qzx0eicc_b2mm&e=

subject: multiple openings in ai and robotics at  the national univeristy of singapore
content: national university of singapore invites applications for both senior and junior posiitons in ai and robotics.  --- the department of computer science at the national university of singapore (nus) invites applications for one distinguished professorship and several tenure-track faculty positions in artificial intelligence, machine learning, computational neuroscience and related areas of robotics. the department enjoys ample research funding, moderate teaching loads, excellent facilities, and extensive international collaborations. we have a full range of faculty covering all major research areas in computer science and a thriving phd program that attracts the brightest students from the region and beyond. more information is available at www.comp.nus.edu.sg/careers.  nus offers highly competitive salaries and is situated in singapore, an english-speaking cosmopolitan city that is a melting pot of many cultures, both the east and the west. singapore offers a safe and family-friend environment with high quality education and healthcare at all levels, as well as very low tax rates. singapore has also recently launched a s$150 million national initiative, ai.sg, to expand research, development, and adoption of ai technologies. ai.sg will be hosted at nus. candidates for the distinguished professor position should have an established record of outstanding research achievements, thought leadership, and international stature in artificial intelligence. candidates for assistant professor positions should demonstrate excellent research potential in ai, and a strong commitment to teaching. truly outstanding assistant professor applicants will be considered for the endowed sung kah kay assistant professorship. application details: submit the following documents (in a single pdf) online via: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__faces.comp.nus.edu.sg&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=5dj7wwfpi1jxrswtwa8_g1tyyso_25crd5ya_pecvfy&s=tt7ncnxpx_iemaak2heyiggkw1vo1fkykvfddk1k_n8&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__faces.comp.nus.edu.sg_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=5dj7wwfpi1jxrswtwa8_g1tyyso_25crd5ya_pecvfy&s=hw66cuihbijdmiboozq5kr0wsjk-bf1csrix3q1raa8&e=>                                                     - a cover letter that indicates the position applied for and the main research interests                             - curriculum vitae                                                                                                                                      - a teaching statement                                                                                                                           - a research statement provide the contact information of 3 referees when submitting your online application, or,  arrange for at least 3 references to be sent directly to csrec at comp.nus.edu.sg <mailto:csrec at comp.nus.edu.sg>.  <mailto:csrec at comp.nus.edu.sg> application reviews will commence immediately and continue until positions are filled. please submit your application by 1 december 2017. if you have further enquiries, please contact the search committee chair, weng-fai wong,  at csrec at comp.nus.edu.sg <mailto:csrec at comp.nus.edu.sg>

subject: aitech robotics & automation(singapore)  is looking for senior electronic & firmware engineer
content: aitech robotics and automation pte ltd is a singapore based company that specializes in designing and manufacturing industrial autonomous vehicles, automated guided vehicles (agv), mobile robots and provides automated solution developed to support companies in the region. in order to support our company expansion, we are currently looking to hire a senior electronic & firmware engineer to enlarge our development team. *senior electronic & firmware engineer  * *responsibilities* - design electrical & electronic systems and support of high complexity technology solutions for industrial autonomous vehicle/agv - propose and define the hardware/firmware architecture strategies - develop firmware per requirements in c/c++ - work with it team to develop control system interface, iot modules, robotic solutions and customize business control system for mobile robots and agvs - develop electronic circuits/prototype boards to perform functions per requirements - define requirements and management of suppliers /external vendors during curcuit design & fabrication, specification and build of systems - apply technical competencies in considerably difficult situations. - provide system maintenance support *requirements* - master/bachelor degree in electrical or electronic engineering - 5+ or more years or more of practical industry experience - *prior experience with ros(robot operating system) is a plus * - strong background in fundamentals of circuit design and analysis - experience with operating and developing code for embedded or singleboard computers - demonstrate ability in analog and digital system design - experience in can, spi, i2c and uart and motor/servo control - familiar with automotive can bus system - familiar with programming language such as c, c++ or python - proficiency with laboratory debugging tools - highly motivated, proactive attitude and great communication skills - must be comfortable working under tight schedules and multi projects - ability to thrive in a small multidisciplinary group and collaborate with international colleagues - willing to relocate to singapore - fluency in english please include your availability, expected salary and reason for leaving current job. we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted thanks email to: jacky-tan at aitech-robotics.com

subject: computer vision/robotics engineer in-reply-to: <45f18e3e-6898-dca8-98ba-9775213f01d5@infiniumrobotics.com> references: <45f18e3e-6898-dca8-98ba-9775213f01d5@infiniumrobotics.com>
content: (sorry for cross posting) infinium robotics is? looking for an experienced computer vision and  robotics engineer to work with our team of hard- core engineers in the  area of robotics and drones in singapore. your main activities will be: ? conducting research and development for robotics navigation (agv/ugv)  and computer vision based navigation, fast detection and scanning  technologies. ? developing algorithms to perform mapping, state estimation,  localization, sensor fusion and autonomous navigation. ? performing tests, problem diagnosis, and debugging. you should?have: ? bachelors or masters in computer science or equivalent engineering  degree. ? experience with ros, opencv, pcl and gazebo, proficiency in c++ and/or  python ? understanding of and experience with any, preferably more of the  following topics:   * optical flow,   * real-time machine vision,   * visual odometry ,   * vision and/or filter based slam,   * sensor fusion,   * 3d mapping   * sensor alignment and calibration,   * agv/ugv control and navigation. ? citable projects demonstrating computer vision / robotics abilities  and experience following additional knowledge will not be required, but considered as a  plus: ? previous work with aerial robotics (drones) or robotics in general is  also highly valuable. ? barcode reading techniques ? user interface programming, sql databases ? cuda programming competitive salary. full time contract. working hours: 09:00 to 18:00 flex. if you are interested, drop our friendly staff an email or a line!! mail: careers at infiniumrobotics.com <mailto:careers at infiniumrobotics.com>  / tel: 65-67744418 / singapore

subject: postdoctoral associate at singapore-mit  alliance for research and technology
content: singapore-mit alliance for research and technology (smart) is a major research enterprise established by the massachusetts institute of technology (mit) in partnership with the national research foundation of singapore (nrf). smart serves as an intellectual hub for international research collaborations, not only between mit and singapore, but also involving researchers from the region and beyond. the current job posting is from the autonomous vehicle lab of the future urban mobility (fm) interdisciplinary research groups (irgs) which is one of the seven irgs established by smart since 2007. the goal of fm irg is to develop innovative mobility solutions that provide safe, comfortable, time and energy efficient transportation to enhance sustainability and societal well-being. job title: postdoctoral associate - autonomous vehicles group (ref: irg_fm_2017_030) future urban mobility interdisciplinary research group project overview: the proposed project involves path planning for multi-class autonomous vehicles which navigate in heterogeneous environments surrounded by pedestrians and other vehicles. the successful candidate will be required to develop and implement planning algorithms on real vehicles including a fleet of golf buggies and an electric car. duties and responsibilities: the fm irg is seeking to employ a postdoctoral associate with the following job scope: ?    development of path planning and decision making algorithms under uncertain driving scenarios ?    implementation of the planning algorithms on real vehicles in pedestrian and on road environments ?    advising and mentoring phd students in the research group ?    advancing research in any of these or other related areas requirements: the most qualified candidates must have a phd degree in related areas and have the following research experience: ?    expertise in software design ?    familiarity with system integration ?    experience in development of autonomous systems ?    familiarity of using ros (robot operating system) is favourable ?    adaptable to various computer languages, including c/c++/python ?    experience in various motion planning methods ?    published research in autonomous navigation  ?    writing scientific reports ?    good command of written and spoken english. to apply, please visit our open positions website at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__smart.mit.edu_careers_career-2dopportunities_job-2dapplication-3fjob-3d200-26job-5fcat-3djob&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0nj_1lsdeduyabigqzezlzzflctiyovbrihvhvodbtu&s=fcg7m7ijhx9xwds68rzsxzzkpzmntgh6awkqqzlq--w&e= interested applicants will have to submit their full cv/resume, cover letter and list of three references (to include reference names and contact information) via the stated website. we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. malika meghjani post doctoral scholar | future urban mobility singapore-mit alliance for research and technology

subject: help calibrate hundreds of self-driving  cars at nutonomy
content: at nutonomy, we develop full-stack autonomous mobility-on-demand solutions: from self-driving cars to fleet management software. our cars have driven passengers on the road in boston and singapore during public pilots. after recently becoming part of the aptiv (ex delphi) family, we are rapidly expanding. today, i would like to highlight a career opportunity related to *sensor calibration and validation*.  as we prepare our software to run on hundreds, and then thousands of cars, we are particularly interested in pushing the state of the art for *self-supervised* *multi-modal* calibration and validation, to work robustly on a sensorius that includes cameras, lidars, radars, imus, and other sensors, in challenging environmental conditions. if interested, please get in touch with me (andrea at nutonomy.com) or dr. maurilio di cicco (maurilio at nutonomy.com), or apply according to the instructions at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.nutonomy.com_careers_-23955123&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=skz7cys0_rxca1dmzw4xii_4jxbvc5g4qtzzhqwyrsk&s=kmseswn4g3u1pkqbv4vr8ij8jxoz9mtt9ojoyd17x3m&e=

subject: post-doctoral research fellow in  control (david braun) in-reply-to: <hk2pr0301mb20330214f2e0a4803f9e0062c7590@hk2pr0301mb2033.apcprd03.prod.outlook.com> references: <hk2pr0301mb20330214f2e0a4803f9e0062c7590@hk2pr0301mb2033.apcprd03.prod.outlook.com>
content: the dynamics and control laboratory at singapore university of technology and design invites applications for a post-doctoral research fellow in control. applicants with expertise in optimal control and model predictive control are encouraged to apply. the ideal candidate has a strong background in control theory with focus on: (1) optimal control (2) model predictive control (3) reinforcement learning applications assembled to a single pdf file should contain: (1) cover letter (max 1 page) (2) cv (3) list of publications (4) name and contact details of two referees the position comes with competitive remuneration determined based on research achievements, experience, and qualification of the candidate. the position is guaranteed for a year to come with a possibility to extend for two additional years. shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview. the position is available with immediate effect. applications should be sent to: david_braun[@]sutd.edu.sg [subject line: postdoc2018]. david braun, phd | assistant professor | dynamics and control laboratory (dcl) singapore university of technology and design (sutd) 8 somapah road, singapore 487372 e-mail: david_braun[@]sutd.edu.sg web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__people.sutd.edu.sg_-7edavid-5fbraun_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nvbkd7ubuj60dtnzyv6ydpb-llyo8kfsvugek9bd3ae&s=20oocj-bz-ruevpo9ndyge1fpeix4wr_nydy84xki24&e= this email may contain confidential and/or proprietary information that is exempt from disclosure under applicable law and is intended for receipt and use solely by the addressee(s) named above. if you are not the intended recipient, you are notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this email, or any attachment, is strictly prohibited. please delete the email immediately and inform the sender. thank you

subject: computer vision/robotics engineer
content: (sorry for cross posting) infinium robotics is looking for experienced computer vision and robotics engineer to work with our team of hard- core engineers in the area of robotics and drones in singapore. your main activities will be: ? conducting research and development for robotics navigation (agv/ugv) and computer vision based navigation, fast detection and scanning technol ogies. ? developing algorithms to perform mapping, state estimation, localization, sensor fusion and autonomous navigation. ? performing tests, problem diagnosis, and debugging. you should have: ? bachelors or masters in computer science or equivalent engineering degree. ? experience with ros, opencv, pcl and gazebo, proficiency in c++ and/or python ? understanding of and experience with any, preferably more of the following  topics:    - optical flow,    - real-time machine vision,    - visual odometry ,    - vision and/or filter based slam,    - sensor fusion,    - 3d mapping    - sensor alignment and calibration,    - agv/ugv control and navigation. ? citable projects demonstrating computer vision / robotics abilities and experience following additional knowledge will not be required, but considered as a plus: ? previous work with aerial  and ground robotics  (drones) or robotics in general is also highly valuable.    - barcode reading techniques    - user interface programming, sql databases    - cuda programming competitive salary. full time contract. working hours: 09:00 to 18:00 flex. if you are interested, drop our friendly staff an email  with your cv. [how to apply] application should include :    1. cv with a full publication, patent and previous employment information    2. github and/or some sample codes.    3. edit the subject of your email  for the job position you prefer. [computer vision    engineer job application / robotics engineer job application]    4. mail to  *soner _at_  **infiniumrobotics**  _dot _ **com*    <careers at infiniumrobotics.com>   with careers at infiniumrobotics.com in    the cc.

subject: ncs research & development (full time  or internship)
content: ncs research & development (full time or internship) ncs r&d?s mission is to invent game changing ideas and bring them to market as compelling, impactful products. we are a newly created division consisting of the singtel cognitive and artificial intelligence lab (scale https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.channelnewsasia.com_news_singapore_singtel-2dntu-2dnrf-2dto-2dset-2dup-2ds-2d42-2d4m-2dlab-2dto-2ddevelop-2drobotics-2d9466818&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dg5dqowhjsxs_zsbhmwybrlhzwpihm_nnf8du-h1gu8&s=tdfalpyd6di_tl0quydflycnnv76iddjnltxv6utdpm&e= ), a product management group, and an engineering group, forming an end-to-end team for designing and building new products for our customers worldwide. if you are an ambitious, imaginative, curious and independent self-starter who work well on teams, come join our world class team of scientists and engineers to solve high impact real world problems with artificial intelligence, robotics, aerial drones, immersive technologies, hyper scale cloud computing and distributed intelligence at the edge. we have multiple job openings for scientists, engineers, and product managers at all levels in the r&d organization. candidates ideally have experience in several of the following areas, and be eager to learn.   *   deep learning, unsupervised learning, cnn, rnn, lstm, gan, caffe, torch, tensorflow, mxnet   *   computer vision and graphics: action recognition, face recognition & verification, image & video synthesis & captioning, object detection and tracking, segmentation, slam, large scale 3d reconstruction, immersive environments, ar/vr/mr, light fields, natural interactions   *   speech & language: voice commands, conversational, code-switching multilingual speech, transcription   *   robotics: ros, deep reinforcement learning, aerial drone control, path planning, dexterous manipulation   *   edge intelligence, embedded processing, internet of things   *   medical imaging and diagnosis   *   high performance computing, parallel computing, distributed computing   *   coding: golang, c/c++, javascript, react, angular, qt, opencv, cuda/opencl, cudnn, tensorrt, dsp, neon, arm compute library, big data, microservices, docker, kubernetes, spark, storm, kafka, hadoop, blockchain   *   product development and management: agile, product requirements, pricing, partnerships ncs, a member of the singtel group, is a global information communications and technology products and service provider with presence in over 20 countries. we deliver end-to-end solutions to help enterprises realize business value through digital transformation and the innovative use of technology. incorporated in 1981 as a part of the national computer board, ncs has grown into the principal it solutions provider for the singapore government, successfully implementing more than 3,000 large-scale, mission-critical, and multi-platform projects for singapore's government ministries and agencies. application instructions: please email your cv to kar han tan at ncs.rnd at ncs.com.sg

subject: opening for a robotics researcher on  slam, 3d perception, computer vision,  machine learning at nanyang technological university, singapore
content: st engineering - ntu corporate lab at nanyang technological university, singapore (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ste-2dntulab.ntu.edu.sg_pages_home.aspx&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=npkbciwrl4tayhppqjjr-bbnnlm8vrneqznuiypvh2e&s=z46jr08d5ielckr81bva3afjcwvmfv59v40utgb_-14&e=) is looking for a highly motivated and skilled robotics researcher with expertise on either slam, 3d perception, computer vision or machine learning. the successful candidate is expected to lead the robot perception research efforts in a project developing autonomous ground and air mapping robots. the applicant must + have a m.sc.or ph.d (or nearing completion of phd) degree related to robotics. + have demonstrated research and engineering skills in one or more of the following - slam, visual odometry,  3d perception and mapping, dense or semi-dense reconstruction, object detection, object and terrain classification, semantic labeling, scene understanding. + be comfortable with software development for robotic systems and genuinely excited about validating research results in field experiments using real robotic systems. preference will be given to applicants with the following additional skills + extensive c/c++/python programming skills + experience in robotic software development using ros. + experience with robotics/perception/machine learning related open source libraries. + good verbal and written communication skills in english. you can send in your cv and a cover letter including a description of past experiences to prof danwei wang at edwwang at ntu.edu.sg as soon as possible. initial contract is for one year with a high possibility of extension based on performance. an attractive remuneration based on the experiences and qualifications and a standard benefit package competitive with the industry will be provided for the successful applicant. thank you!

subject: articares - product development  specialist(s)
content: product development specialist(s) multiple positions available. 1 year with possibility of long-term extension overview articares is a rehabilitation robotics start-up from nanyang technological university, singapore (ranked #11 worldwide). at articares we focus on developing healthcare solutions for elderly and neurologically impaired population. our first robotic setup for stroke rehabilitation namely h-man has received extensive interest internationally and is currently going through final phase of development.  we are looking for exceptional individuals (full time) to play prominent role in our product development team. this is a unique opportunity of its kind to grow with one of the high impact companies in healthcare. we have a 100% start-up environment where you will apply skills in different stages of product development. we offer promise for growth and great packages for the right candidate. we have a strong multinational team with collaborators and partners from europe, us and asia. hence we encourage applicants willing to work in a culturally diverse environment.  responsibilities and duties ?	managing development schedules closely to ensure all stages of the development process are met in a timely manner. ?	developing robotic control for innovative technologies, including but not limited to h-man. ?	integration of product manuals and technical details to go along with the product. ?	supervising and working on electronics and/or software development teams as and when needed. ?	implementing servicing strategy of articares products. ?	proposing and implementing new solutions for addition into pipeline of products.   the list is not exhaustive.  qualifications ?	preferably phd in robotics or rehabilitation technology but experts in electronics and software development are also encouraged to apply ?	hands-on team player who is willing to work directly on design and development of medical products ?	industrial experience is preferred. ?	robotics, preferably with hands on experience in at-least one of the following:  ?	robotics control ?	embedded electronics, including experience in firmware coding and pcb design & fabrication ?	software development, preferably with experience in serious games design and development ?	cloud based data management experience  ?	fluency in mandarin or german is preferred.  salary salary is commensurate with experience. about singapore if you haven?t already heard about singapore https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.visitsingapore.com_en_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kh13gdtrytkk1cunjmtztxvalzdiizzz7kfvwtxy3ri&s=vfpvmbu_j-86pljg01i0-ovuguz2qzobv9jxh4aw1tq&e= for more information on the job application. please contact dr mohammad esmaeili esmaeili at articares.com for more information. if you are interested, please send your cv together with a letter of motivation to jobs at articares.com  best asif hussain co-founder & ceo, articares pte ltd -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kh13gdtrytkk1cunjmtztxvalzdiizzz7kfvwtxy3ri&s=5hrfjhstnvdz_07ac4d0er0es1h6f0mllvxotenqgra&e=

subject: research associate in robotics
content: research associate job description: the institute for media innovation (imi https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__imi.ntu.edu.sg_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hbg-kayo8mvpnqxuuj4mzvwtlncegzh9mpwkxj0bwwa&s=bvurvvqaowliltfftrv7f8wc2ofyz7ffiyju-r0jc8e&e=) at nanyang technological university immediately invites applications for research associates to work in our leading research media institute (imi) in singapore, in the area of social robots. researchers will have an opportunity to work in a cutting-edge interactive environment with top equipment including a very realistic human-like robot, several other small size robots. our main research goal is to develop functional robots which are aware of the environment and conscious of ongoing situations. in order for these awareness and consciousness to be developed, we need to simulate human perception, based on the electrical activity of the brain, captured by digital eeg (electroencephalography) technology. brain states and erps will be analysed by using techniques like time-frequency analysis and phase synchrony. job requirement: the candidate should hold a master degree from a reputed university in the field of social robotics or related topics. the applicant must have experience in some of the areas as follows: ?         proficient in one or more coding language like c/c++, python, java etc. ?         hands on experience in one or more listed area: robot motion control, robot navigation or path planning, rtos, computer vision, computer graphics, 3d modelling technology or ai and deep learning, ros (robot operating system). ?         deep learning and convolutional architecture for fast feature embedding (caffe). ?         experience with 3d printing including design, modelling, processing. ?         experience with eeg software and technology ?         computational methods for data analysis and brain signal analysis ?         experience in neurobehavioral assessment application procedure: please submit the following to imi-recruitment at ntu.edu.sg<mailto:imi-recruitment at ntu.edu.sg> ?         statement of support of application explaining why you believe you are a suitable candidate for this post, how you meet its requirements and the experience which you have that is relevant. please highlight particular achievements ?         curriculum vitae with photo ?         two names and contacts of referees ?         salary expectation ?         availability date review of applicants will begin immediately and continue until the positions are filled. ntu offers a vibrant multidisciplinary research environment, with both students and faculty members enjoying a host of opportunities for research collaboration with world-leading universities and renowned institutes. there is a strong research culture where innovation and critical enquiry are key features. ntu researchers are immersed in the best of work environment. we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: two postdoctoral positions in deep  learning for tactile perception
content: two postdoctoral positions in deep learning for tactile perception  link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.comp.nus.edu.sg_about_depts_cs_recruitment_research_-23ad40&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=5vrjehyzt6-xqxywh_tv7op0dswcgorhdicyog2zkz0&s=lolwbdz3lnhginzt3qiu_sfgrbkizperpuqjuiwqsh0&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.comp.nus.edu.sg_about_depts_cs_recruitment_research_-23ad40&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=5vrjehyzt6-xqxywh_tv7op0dswcgorhdicyog2zkz0&s=lolwbdz3lnhginzt3qiu_sfgrbkizperpuqjuiwqsh0&e=> the computer science department at national university of singapore is seeking two motivated postdoctoral researchers with expertise in deep learning and robotics, starting as early as april 2018. the position is for a 2.5 year project to develop new deep learning techniques for fast, efficient perception with next-generation artificial skin on robots.  requirements: * completed all requirements for a phd degree. a solid track record of publications at major ai, ml and robotics conferences is preferred. * expertise in robotics and/or machine learning is strongly preferred. * experience in human-robot interaction or tactile learning, is a plus. * committed to full-time employment at nus, singapore. how to apply : to apply for this position, please send your cv to harold soh at harold at comp.nus.edu.sg <mailto:harold at comp.nus.edu.sg> with a cover letter and a brief statement of previous work and research interests. the initial term of appointment will be 1 year extensible for another year upon review of satisfactory performance. the selected candidates will be offered competitive salaries and benefits. nus is a world-class university that provides an outstanding and supportive research environment. singapore is a vibrant city with low taxes and research hub in asia. best wishes, harold

subject: drones and v-slam: a post-doc position  is available at ntu (singapore)
content: motion planning of unmanned aerial vehicles with visual-aided simultaneous localization and mapping (v-slam): this project aims to realize motion planning of unmanned aerial vehicles in priori unknown environments by vision-based sensing. in this project, v-slam algorithms will be developed, and tested during fast flights with a multi-rotor equipped with a camera, lidar, and inertial sensors. v-slam will provide an instantaneous local map of surroundings in which local motion planning of multi-rotor will be conducted. [requirements] -	ph.d. in robotics or closely related areas -	solid background in computer vision, simultaneous localization and mapping -	solid background in python, c/c++ programming -	solid background in ros-gazebo -	experience with real world robots, sensors -	excellent english skills (writing and speaking) [additional desired features] -	basic knowledge/experience in motion planning research -	basic knowledge/experience in unmanned aerial vehicle research  -	publication in relevant conferences (e.g., icra, iros, rss, cvpr) or journals (e.g., ijrr, tro, ar) -	available for overseas travel for collaboration [offer] -	1-year contract (with a possible extension) with a competitive salary -	research opportunity in one of the world?s leading technical universities (#4 in engineering and  technology, qs world university rankings 2018) -	exciting research environment in flight mechanics and control lab ? ntu -	possibility to visit collaborators in aarhus university, denmark and unr, usa [how to apply] application should consist of: -	cv with a full publication list -	contact details of three referees  these documents should be compiled as a single pdf file, named as "<name>_<surname>.pdf", and should be sent to ntu.fmc.job.applications at gmail.com this project will be conducted in a collaboration with aarhus university, denmark and unr, usa. assoc. prof. erdal kayacan                                                                                    aarhus university, denmark                                                           www.erdal.info assoc prof domenico campolo nanyang technological university (ntu), singapore   ----- domenico campolo (assoc. prof)   robotics research centre   school of mechanical & aerospace engineering    nanyang technological university (ntu), singapore. --   email:  d.campolo at ntu.edu.sg    web:    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntu.edu.sg_home_d.campolo_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tj1mtlngxgacdlaofp8pyly1lli5i4xotouxzc9hchm&s=zkei0kadfj6xykehe_oajqjbp8wl3mc8auacwiarkxq&e= -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tj1mtlngxgacdlaofp8pyly1lli5i4xotouxzc9hchm&s=p8dvqdqhynmzp9io_7sb4brhv8dxmb2tjwqi837_pq8&e=

content: motion planning of unmanned aerial vehicles with visual-aided simultaneous localization and mapping (v-slam): this project aims to realize motion planning of unmanned aerial vehicles in priori unknown environments by vision-based sensing. in this project, v-slam algorithms will be developed, and tested during fast flights with a multi-rotor equipped with a camera, lidar, and inertial sensors. v-slam will provide an instantaneous local map of surroundings in which local motion planning of multi-rotor will be conducted. [requirements] -	m.s. in robotics or closely related areas -	background in computer vision, simultaneous localization and mapping -	background in python, c/c++ programming -	excellent english skills (writing and speaking) [additional desired features] -	background in ros-gazebo -	experience with real world robots, sensors -	basic knowledge/experience in motion planning research -	basic knowledge/experience in unmanned aerial vehicle research  -	publication in relevant conferences (e.g., icra, iros, rss, cvpr) or journals (e.g., ijrr, tro, ar) -	available for overseas travel for collaboration [offer] -	1-year contract (with a possible extension) with a competitive salary -	research opportunity in one of the world?s leading technical universities (#4 in engineering and technology, qs world university rankings 2018) -	exciting research environment in flight mechanics and control lab ? ntu -	possibility to visit collaborators in aarhus university, denmark and unr, usa [how to apply] application should consist of: -	cv with a full publication list -	contact details of three referees  these documents should be compiled as a single pdf file, named as "<name>_<surname>.pdf", and should be sent to ntu.fmc.job.applications at gmail.com [for more info] (this project will be conducted in a collaboration with aarhus university, denmark and unr, usa) ___ assoc. prof. erdal kayacan                                                                                     aarhus university, denmark                                                           www.erdal.info ___ assoc. prof. domenico campolo nanyang technological university, singapore ----- domenico campolo (assoc. prof)   robotics research centre   school of mechanical & aerospace engineering    nanyang technological university (ntu), singapore. --   email:  d.campolo at ntu.edu.sg    web:    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntu.edu.sg_home_d.campolo_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kd91dlelckevcioyhufl13jlyfikq837knrqck6kahq&s=n8gsvgk1-l-jlsgf20g4adjgujpozbqzxlxippfyvxg&e= -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kd91dlelckevcioyhufl13jlyfikq837knrqck6kahq&s=18m61vkly3prs3kufflssanty-gyyrlexf-m6ppcjqc&e=

subject: researcher openings at nanyang  technological university, singapore
content: st engineering - ntu corporate lab at nanyang technological university, singapore (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ste-2dntulab.ntu.edu.sg_pages_home.aspx&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rlnlu84sk-kqftn1lfuvhx7egsyejlruagnqsmfasgm&s=bomklm0jinfvjyt8o1t7jnow8ppiyaemcuym8lxq1pu&e=) has two openings (1 research fellow, 1 research associate) for highly motivated and skilled researchers to join a research project aimed at developing computer vision based navigation solutions for unmanned aerial vehicles. the successful candidate will work with prof. danwei wang (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__goo.gl_ujjb9u&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rlnlu84sk-kqftn1lfuvhx7egsyejlruagnqsmfasgm&s=dw_ekioje6522hfhay4jp5duqlfr-jpp-rjnqk6ve48&e=) and a group of researchers at nanyang technological university, singapore. the successful candidate for the research fellow position will lead the research and development on novel computer vision based uav state estimation, navigation and control. the research associate will collaborate with the research fellow on the research and development effort. following are the requirements for the two positions. the applicant must     + have a ph.d (for research fellow), master's degree (for research associate) in robotics, computer vision or a related descipline.     + have demonstrated research and engineering skills in vision based state estimation and vision based uav navigation/control.     + be comfortable with software development for robotic systems and genuinely excited about validating research results in field experiments.     + have prior experimental experience on uavs. preference will be given to applicants with the following additional skills     + c/c++ programming skills.     + experience in robotic software development using ros.     + good verbal and written communication skills in english. initial contract is for one year with a possibility of extension based on performance. an attractive remuneration based on the experiences and qualifications and a standard benefit package competitive with the industry will be provided for the successful applicant. interested candidates please send your cv with a cover letter to prof. danwei wang at edwwang at ntu.edu.sg thank you!

subject: multiple research fellow positions at  singapore university of technology and design
content: singapore university of technology and design (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.sutd.edu.sg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hzpibnth44d0tvyfumz3ruey2x-_mu6fj21tthd34py&s=0r-sdrrcdql0zqq5bjpor7il0ho-xoxiwi_9wxqzpku&e=<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.sutd.edu.sg_&d=dwmfaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=u_6k8lalxc2pnq91pd4ewpo9d_ows1vl6ohhypoy6ju&s=o0zwewhqj561yzdj2ws3qxupm7c56ap0yjguqohxkls&e=>) immediately invites applications for multiple research fellow positions to work in singapore, in the following areas: ?      robust perception, planning, and control for field robots ?      simultaneous localization and mapping ?      experimental robotics ?      novel mechanism synthesis and analysis the position requires a ph.d. in mechanical/electrical and electronics/computer engineering or a related area. candidates are expected to possess experience in field robotic systems as evidenced by publications and international conferences participation. strong commitment to research is essential. we offer highly competitive salary which is determined based on the applicants' research achievements, experience, and qualifications. it is fixed-term and filled initially for 1 year with an option for extension for another 1 more year. singapore possesses a low-income tax and details can be found athttps://www.iras.gov.sg/irashome/individuals/locals/working-out-your-taxes/income-tax-rates/<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iras.gov.sg_irashome_individuals_locals_working-2dout-2dyour-2dtaxes_income-2dtax-2drates_&d=dwmfaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=u_6k8lalxc2pnq91pd4ewpo9d_ows1vl6ohhypoy6ju&s=srrxzbaqeo5xmbvcvgzvey8hg65_p8pjg-_gudl8_qw&e=> for the application, please email the following documents attached to the email in a single pdf-file: 1)      curriculum vitae (with contact details) 2)      list of publications 3)      availability date 4)      expected salary the application should be in english and sent to a/prof. mohan rajesh elara (rajeshelara at sutd.edu.sg<mailto:rajeshelara at sutd.edu.sg>) by may 21, 2018. the singapore university of technology and design (sutd) aims to become the center and stronghold of global research and breakthroughs through creative technical research and education anchored in design within a multi-disciplinary approach. thank you for your attention! best regards, mohan this email may contain confidential and/or proprietary information that is exempt from disclosure under applicable law and is intended for receipt and use solely by the addressee(s) named above. if you are not the intended recipient, you are notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this email, or any attachment, is strictly prohibited. please delete the email immediately and inform the sender. thank you

subject: cri group @ ntu is recruiting,  let's meet up at icra!
content: dear colleagues, the control - robotics - intelligence (cri) group @ ntu, singapore, has multiple openings at different levels (phd student, engineer, post-doc) in the following broad fields: - motion planning; - control; - vision; - learning; - system integration. detailed information on our research can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntu.edu.sg_home_cuong_&d=dwid-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gen8cg_vcdsavrodynnrj1551mzqx1iggntbicgkuwg&s=butclyro3fzs2g5nruzbdxleycyhihuicuwbeybolik&e=. our research regularly appears at major robotics venues (science robotics, ijrr, ieee tro, rss, icra). life and work environments in singapore are great, and salary is competitive. interested candidates are invited to send a cv and their most significant publications and/or software projects (e.g. github repo) to cuong at ntu.edu.sg. if you are attending icra 2018 in brisbane, don't hesitate to drop me an email to arrange a meeting during the conference. looking forward to hearing from you! cuong --  quang-cuong pham www.normalesup.org/~pham www.ntu.edu.sg/home/cuong

subject: open positions in artificial  intelligence and machine learning
content: wallenberg ai, autonomous systems and software program (wasp) is  sweden ?s largest ever individual research program, a major national initiative for basic research, education and faculty recruitment. the total budget for the program is more than 3.5 billion sek, and major goals are more than 50 new professors and more than 300 new phds within ai, autonomous systems and software.   wasp open positions: wallenberg chairs in ai and professorships in ai/machine learning   wallenberg chairs in ai are professorships at the highest level. up to five positions will open during spring 2018. interested candidates may already now contact bertil andersson, bertil at ntu.edu.sg <mailto:bertil at ntu.edu.sg> with copies to mille millnert, mille.millnert at liu.se <mailto:mille.millnert at liu.se> and lars nielsen, lars.nielsen at liu.se <mailto:lars.nielsen at liu.se>.   wasp professorships in ai/ machine learning are positions primarily at the assistant professor level. they could also be on the level of associate professor or professor. each position comes with an attractive start package. up to seven positions within ai/machine learning will open during spring 2018. information about the prioritized areas? <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__wasp-2d sweden subject: robotics jobs (computer vision, software,  mathematics, mechatronics) at tumcreate singapore
content: tumcreate is a leading research institute set up by the technical university of munich, germany in collaboration with the singapore government. tumcreate has received funding and support for the speedcargo project from the civil aviation authority of singapore (caas) & the national research foundation (nrf) to develop automation solutions that will transform the air freight logistics sector. the speedcargo solution is the world's first ai-powered robotic solution for automatic build-up and break down of aviation cargo pallets and will help singapore lead the transformation of the logistics industry globally. the project is seeking technical experts with a passion for creating world class products, and a willingness to work in a fast paced, quality obsessed, multi-cultural global environment. on successful completion, the project will spin-off as a start-up with members of the project team having the option to join the start-up with benefits that include attractive esops. apply now if you are interested in working on cutting edge technologies, changing the world with your work and joining a dynamic start-up team. for open position in robotics, vision, mathematical optimisation, mechatronics ... please have a look ate the job posting under https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.speedcargo.sg_jobs&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dnk6ikslftcssu7255jhi5gsrgsrimkgm8m0hoixtzk&s=ovvtt_-2zjon5cdzibbwbjqfjjwl6new_bk9qpuzbqo&e= subject: mechatronics engineer at bio robotics  design lab, singapore university of technology and design
content: dear all, bio robotics design lab at singapore university of technology and design has an opening for highly motivated and skilled mechatronics engineer to join marine robotics research project. the project is headed by prof. pablo valdivia y alvarado and a group of researchers at sutd. the position is available from august 1, 2018 or as soon as possible hereafter. *job description, responsibilities and skills* candidate must possess at least bachelor's degree/masters' degree in electrical / electronics / mechanical / mechatronics engineering or equivalent. at least 2 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. required skill(s): solidworks, cad, robotics, low power electronics, pcb design, 3d printing, embedded systems. develop mechatronic systems for bio inspired marine robots for field deployment including mechanical design, embedded system development, pcb design, firmware development and testing. working knowledge of robot operating system (ros), rtos, i2c, serial communication protocols, c/c++/python programming. excellent with solidworks designs, tolerance specifications, dfm, dfa methods. proficient in electronic design software preferably altium designer. preferably entry level specialized in engineering - mechatronics / electronics or equivalent. great technical writing and communication skills. have passion towards building robots. candidates can send a portfolio showcasing past projects. details regarding the groups's research can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__brd.sutd.edu.sg_portfolio-2d2_&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=i_gmwsviy7fiq6cedpbfjdsyddszubinst5q4uzdpam&s=ybstrjvxl3tqkhpbvf6f7p1wy6hviorw62uywjlvquq&e= initial contract is for one year with a possibility of extension based on performance. interested candidates can send updated resume, portfolio and following details to vinothglitch-at-gmail-dot-com with "roboticsre" in the subject line please note that only the short-listed candidates will be notified for interview. last drawn salary, expected salary, notice period / availability thanks, vinoth research associate singapore university of technology and design bio design lab, 8 somapah road, #03.509 singapore 487372 -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=i_gmwsviy7fiq6cedpbfjdsyddszubinst5q4uzdpam&s=myew4ysybcdznxxoq419u9m7jympyet5t7awjegk4h8&e=

subject: researcher openings at nanyang  technological university, singapore
content: school of electrical and electronic engineering (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.eee.ntu.edu.sg_pages_default.aspx&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fzwocrmsj70zkhogs7ise473uhi2rsyqheqwo7jamm4&s=qr9akhwsnp3bghm3zkpnwqadakh8zrzmvos8ivvsynw&e=) at nanyang technological university, singapore has three openings for highly motivated and skilled mobile robotics researchers to join a new research project. the project will be conducted in association with an industrial partner with the aim of improving mobile robots' autonomy in challenging outdoor neighborhood environments. you will be working with prof. danwei wang (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__goo.gl_ujjb9u&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fzwocrmsj70zkhogs7ise473uhi2rsyqheqwo7jamm4&s=yni4p5falx3uerxuuyzkn5w1rko_n1nq7rdjruvax_u&e=) and a group of researchers at ntu, singapore. responsibilities and skills/educational requirements for the three positions are as follows. research fellow   *   to lead the overall research project with a specialized focus on localization, mapping, autonomous navigation and learning based robot navigation   *   is expected to guide fellow researchers and research students on research and engineering aspects related to autonomous navigation such as 3d perception, terrain classification, semantic labelling and mapping, path planning and control.   *   must have a ph.d in ee/cs/robotic or a related discipline.   *   must have demonstrated research and engineering skills in one or more of mobile robot localization, mapping, slam, autonomous navigation, topological mapping/localization and navigation, machine learning for robot navigation/control.   *   must have a clear system level understanding of technologies and challenges associated with autonomous navigation of ground robots in real environments. research associate ? 3d perception   *   is expected to conduct research and development on 3d perception for autonomous mobile robots.   *   must have a master's degree in a related discipline.   *   must have demonstrated research and engineering skills in at least one of 3d perception, computer vision for robotics, machine/deep learning for robotic perception, terrain classification, semantic labelling/mapping. research associate ? planning and control   *   is expected to adapt existing motion planning and control algorithms to challenging real environments and conduct research on novel path planning/control strategies for ugvs.   *   must have a master's degree in cs/ee/robotics or a related discipline.   *   must have demonstrated research and engineering skills in robot motion planning/control with a deep understanding on real time 2d/3d path planning and control algorithms. all researchers are expected to be comfortable with software development for robotic systems and genuinely excited about validating research results in field experiments. preference will be given to applicants with the following additional skills   *   prior experimental experience in real mobile robotics.   *   c/c++/python programming skills.   *   experience in robotic software development using ros.   *   good understanding on ros's navigation stack.   *   experience with standard robotics and machine learning related open source software libraries.   *   demonstrated capability in good software engineering practices.   *   good verbal and written communication skills in english. initial contract is for one year with a possibility of extension based on performance. an attractive remuneration based on the experiences and qualifications and a standard benefit package competitive with the industry will be provided for the successful applicants. interested applicants please send in your cv with a cover letter and any other supplementary material to prof. danwei wang at edwwang at ntu.edu.sg<mailto:edwwang at ntu.edu.sg>. please note that only the short-listed candidates will be notified for interview. thank you!

subject: multiple positions @ open robotics in  singapore
content: we're growing the open robotics team in our new singapore office [1]! we have multiple open positions in singapore, including: * devops engineer * simulation content developer * software engineer: distributed systems * software engineer: web singapore citizenship or permanent residency is required for these positions. for more information and to apply, please visit our careers page:   https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.openrobotics.org_careers_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=v9jwiddwv6iu6kllvtr8k86761nt9xxlf19ypewjuzk&s=2f-rxmfge01e7rgyfeerw3pormzlehaiiyotogbvugy&e= --- at open robotics, we work with industry, academia, and government to create and support open software and hardware for use in robotics, from research and education to product development. the unifying theme of our team and our work is openness. we use and we build open systems, and we foster an open source community that is at the heart of our projects. we are seeking motivated, friendly, collaborative individuals with excellent software skills and an interest in robotics. we are committed to building a culturally diverse team and we encourage applications from women and members of other traditionally underrepresented groups in the tech community. we maintain an open and interactive work environment and take pride in striking a sustainable work/life balance. we develop software in the open and collaborate freely with colleagues at other companies and universities. we approach the engineering and science of robotics systems with a focus on quality and usability, and we aim for our work to have impact far beyond our team. we believe that we're changing the world with what we?re doing, and we hope that you agree. subject: postdoc in computer vision at liu
content: the computer vision laboratory at link?ping university offers a postdoc position. the postdoc will work as a researcher in a wasp-project on machine learning in collaboration with ntu singapore. wallenberg ai, autonomous systems and software program (wasp) is  sweden ?s largest ever individual research program, a major national initiative for strategically motivated basic research, education and faculty recruitment. the program addresses research on artificial intelligence and autonomous systems acting in collaboration with humans, adapting to their environment through sensors, information and knowledge, and forming intelligent systems-of-systems. the postdoc is expected to publish papers at high ranking venues such as nips, icml, iclr, cvpr, iccv, and eccv. applications must be sent no later than 28th of june and through the link https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__liu.se_en_work-2dat-2dliu_vacancies-3frmpage-3djob-26rmjob-3d8820-26rmlang-3duk&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lggw2rurng-ng173_xf6beczipbio3noqudke3lo93g&s=mq_flamvhdbwxwwwedn7ovgajfj7aiazle48ofkfcpg&e= best regards / med v?nliga h?lsningar michael felsberg -- professor michael felsberg??????????????  tel: +46 13 282460 computer vision laboratory????????????  mobile: +46 702 202460 link?ping university??????????????????????????? email: michael.felsberg at liu.se se-581 83 link?ping,  sweden ??????????? https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__users.isy.liu.se_cvl_mfe_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lggw2rurng-ng173_xf6beczipbio3noqudke3lo93g&s=oz-43g05cwytav9dkunv-z2jt5llpagqdlozyrxds_u&e=

subject: call for nominations associate  editors ieee robotics & automation magazine in-reply-to: <62114993-5038-4d1f-a23f-f2357c47c60b@gmail.com> references: <62114993-5038-4d1f-a23f-f2357c47c60b@gmail.com>
content: dear prof vanderborght is self-nomination allowed ? thanks. yours sincerely meng joo office: s1-b1c-90 tel: (65) 67904529 fax: (65) 67933318 email: emjer at ntu.edu.sg -----original message----- from: robotics-worldwide <robotics-worldwide-bounces at usc.edu> on behalf of bram vanderborght (eic ieee ram) sent: wednesday, 13 june 2018 2:28 pm to: robotics-worldwide at usc.edu subject: [robotics-worldwide] [jobs] call for nominations associate editors ieee robotics & automation magazine call for nominations associate editors ieee robotics & automation magazine ieee robotics & automation magazine is soliciting nominations for two new associate editors, to begin in january 2019. the associate editors play an important role in maintaining the caliber of the magazine by ensuring the quality of published articles by implementing reviews of technical features according to ieee guidelines, soliciting interesting and topical material articles for publication in the magazine, guiding the overall direction of the publication and providing feedback from the readership through e-mail conversations, teleconferences, and twice-yearly in-person meetings held in conjunction with ieee conference on robotics & automation (icra) and the ieee international conference on intelligent robots and systems (iros). associate editor terms normally consist of a one-year probation period followed by two years of additional service if performance is satisfactory. applicants should have a strong technical background and excellent english language skills. nominations should include a resume (not to exceed three pages), previous experience with publications as a reviewer or in other capacities, and areas of technical expertise. please submit nominations as a single pdf file to ieee robotics & automation society at ras at ieee.org by 1 september 2018. kind regards bram vanderborght editor in chief ieee robotics & automation magazine ieeerameic at gmail.com _______________________________________________ robotics-worldwide mailing list robotics-worldwide at usc.edu http://duerer.usc.edu/mailman/listinfo.cgi/robotics-worldwide subject: multiple positions at the robotics  research centre - ntu (singapore)
content: the robotics research centre at nanyang technological university (ntu, singapore; prof. dino accoto) invites applications for the following open positions:  - phd students  - research associate  - post-doctoral research fellow targeted research areas  - development of novel actuation, sensing and control technologies for soft robots physically interacting with humans;  - wearable robots for augmenting human capabilities;  - upper and lower limb rehabilitation robotics;  - haptic interfaces. requirements  - experience in mechatronic design (commensurate to the position): mechanical design, embedded systems, fabrication technologies;  - proficiency in spoken and written english. additional requirements  -  creativity;  -  analytical skills (modelling, computational methods for numerical simulations);  -  proficiency in at least one programming language among the following: matlab/octave, python, c, c++. responsibilities responsibilities will depend from the profile and seniority of the candidate and may include the following: development and experimental testing of novel robotic systems and sub-systems according to specific project plans; technical reporting; contributing to paper preparation; assisting in research proposal drafting; supporting the supervision of undergraduate projects. about the re.botics lab, embedded in the robotics research centre at ntu, pursuits research in robotics adopting a holistic approach for the development of novel and diverse machines for the human well-being, both for work and life. targeted applications include: medical robots (e.g. for diagnosis, therapy and rehabilitation) and assistive/augmenting robots (e.g. for manual workers, elderly and disabled people). the holistic approach refers to any part or subsystem of the robot, such as mechanics, sensors, actuators, control, and intelligence, being designed having in mind the final objective of optimizing the system as a whole. also research in design methodologies and fabrication technologies is pursued adopting soft robotics, embodied intelligence, multiscale and multiphysics approaches. how to apply interested candidates are invited to email:   *   curriculum vitae;   *   a max 2 pages letter describing: i) motivation; ii) professional expectations; iii) research interests, and iv) research plan;   *   contact details of at least two referrers available to be contacted upon request, to prof. dino accoto: daccoto at ntu.edu.sg shortlisted candidates will be contacted by august 31, 2018. ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: robot engineer/scientist (singapore)
content: iim pte ltd founded in 2015. we are a start-up company in the scientific and technical activities industry, also the world leading r&d centre and provider of intelligent service robots. we have 2 offices, our main office is in china, located in the torch building of china merchants group, the first demonstration base of mass entrepreneurship and innovation. in 2015, we opened our new research and development center in singapore to leverage on the big pool of local talents that the country is well known for. our partners in singapore include capitaland and imda. our team in singapore focus on creating intelligent algorithm and implement on our robots. apart from that, we have a mechanical designing team to design our robots to call it our own. our technology includes robot environment build, robot navigation and robot perception. we are expert in deep learning technology and applied in facial recognition. we strive to improve tremendously by doing research and test it on our robots. *job description:* we are seeking software engineers to work together with our robot navigation team. this job is focused on robot navigation system integration and development. the work scopes mainly include the following:  1. sensor fusion: able to preprocess and filter the data from the laser scanner, imu, sonar sensor, camera and etc. 2. algorithm implementation: able to implement navigation and localization algorithms using c++.  3. responsible for programming, debugging, testing, modifications, deployment, operations, and maintenance of the above applications. *requirements:* bachelor's degree or higher in robotics, ece, computer science, or a related field;  good programming skill: c/c++, arduino; familiar with linux and ros for robot; experience in slam algorithms will be bonus; knowledge of multiple line lidar will be bonus; knowledge of vision localization will be bonus; excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills; highly motivated, competitive, self-confident. * *monthly payment: sgd$4000-6000 *work location: one-north, singapore *can help apply for the work permit visa *please send your resume to the following email address if you are interested, *email:cindy.wang at iim.ltd* -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=elccxaq--mhfkmvudiv__2ssqqtwh5i74w4sfz0is18&s=iuxg529cbg3_ngk-kbrmot6xnevaqlgmz5qnb1ujlqk&e=

content: we are seeking highly motivated researchers to perform research on robot platform development  (flexible and compliant robots) in medical applications. the perspective researchers will work with an interdisciplinary team consists of researchers from the nus advanced robotics center and surgeons from national university hospital and singapore institute for neurotechnology (sinapse)<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__sinapse.nus.edu.sg_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=ebpkvoyx1ujhhga8skmagpptjqqfx9hjidp_zxf33vi&s=-vksdfud_raotzpd6bosue2kpjbrzfdwpcshvhmrszs&e=>. [qualifications] - honorary phd or master degree in mechanical, mechatronics, automation or intelligent control background - must have hands-on mechanical development experience in machines, instrumentation, automation & control, ai, serial or parallel mechanisms/manipulators. - can demonstrate your previous hardware development experience in the application - self-motivated and show academic publication records preferably in high rank journals - strong problem-solving, writing, programming, interpersonal, and analytical skills.
