subject: scientist position in tactile  perception and tactile-guided manipulation @ a*star, singapore
content: the robotics and autonomous systems department at the a*star institute for infocomm research, singapore, invites application for a research scientist position in tactile perception and tactile-guided manipulation. we offer a highly competitive remuneration, leave and welfare package which commensurate with the experience of each applicant. details on each position can be found below. applications will be reviewed until the positions are filled. interested applicants are requested to submit: - a cover letter - a curriculum vitae that includes the name, address and email of 2 referees to wuy(at)i2r.a-star.edu.sg as soon as possible. shortlisted candidates will be notified through email for interview. ============================================================================ job description successful candidate will be involved in some or all of the following tasks: - research and development of multimodal active perceptual and learning algorithms for environmental understanding and safe and agile object manipulation with a focus on using event-based high-resolution tactile sensory inputs - system integration to deliver functioning modules in a collaborative industrial robot environment - actively collaborate with other researchers in scientific writing, testing, experimentations, and trouble-shootings the robots during testing and real-world trial deployments - closely collaborate with other researchers to conduct research on robotic affordance understanding, grasping and perception, including tactile perception technology to create new robotic capabilities - realisation of algorithms developed into computational footprints that are suitable for deployment in robots, including optimizing the algorithms to allow for real time processing or deployment in an embedded processor - support the research and development activities of the department in robot learning and dexterity job requirements - phd in computer science or electrical, electronics, computer, mechanical or mechatronics engineering - background in relevant robotics field - proficient in programming skills (c/c++ and/or python) - strong research track record - good analytical skills, innovative and proven track record in solving problems encountered in projects that are relevant to robotics - good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills ============================================================================ about us the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) is singapore's lead public sector agency that fosters world-class scientific research and talent to drive economic growth and transform singapore into a vibrant knowledge-based and innovation driven economy.  for more information about a*star, please visit: www.a-star.edu.sg<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.a-2dstar.edu.sg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lh4vkbhkmnfdm45e7d_m2fbn1yswgmoswoo8gpiqtrc&s=fkkhu7pbshig4xs_epitvansk0u4n9vfsstbvak6exa&e=> the institute for infocomm research (i?r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore's largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.i2r.a-2dstar.edu.sg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lh4vkbhkmnfdm45e7d_m2fbn1yswgmoswoo8gpiqtrc&s=fijo9p80oujxpzxyak3afwjzcnctzqmrcqgmcw8vwm0&e=> best wishes, yan this e-mail and any attachments are only for the use of the intended recipient and may contain material that is confidential, privileged and/or protected by the official secrets act. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it or notify the sender immediately. please do not copy or use it for any purpose or disclose the contents to any other person.

subject: postdoctoral fellow & research engineer  positions in-reply-to: <965ea188-c444-4b40-807e-7332f170c124@sutd.edu.sg> references: <965ea188-c444-4b40-807e-7332f170c124@sutd.edu.sg>
content: dear all, we have several available postdoctoral and research engineer positions at the singapore university of technology and design (sutd) to work in: 1) automation of a fleet of 3-d printers; 2) autonomous systems for ward settings; 3) learning and perception for robotic manipulation with human in the loop; and 4) human-robot interaction, with particular interest in either sensing human psychological status and ar; qualification: - relevant degree in electrical engineering, , mechanical engineering, robotics, or related areas - strong hands on experience preference will be given to those with prior project experience in at least one of the following: 1) machine learning for robotics application; 2) slam; 3) programming of ar goggles; and 4) sensor fusion. applications, assembled as a single pdf file, should contain a complete resume, full list of publications, as well as the names and contact information of up to three references. interested applicants may send his/her cv to asst prof u-xuan tan via email ( uxuan_tan at sutd.edu.sg ). review of applications will continue until the position is filled.  only shortlisted candidates will be notified. regards, u-xuan tan, phd assistant professor, engineering product development (epd) singapore university of technology and design (sutd) 8 somapah road, singapore 487372 email: uxuan_tan at sutd.edu.sg did: +65 6499 4524 website: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__people.sutd.edu.sg_-7euxuan-5ftan_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yqv-xpgsekpjsum3lojtarznj4bpb4iq8et6fckb7b4&s=fg5qbbw7ihkxsbaa0tjeebn1opxkuodgfdktnpdndsk&e= this email may contain confidential and/or proprietary information that is exempt from disclosure under applicable law and is intended for receipt and use solely by the addressee(s) named above. if you are not the intended recipient, you are notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this email, or any attachment, is strictly prohibited. please delete the email immediately and inform the sender. thank you

subject: phd positions in flexible mechatronics,  wearable devices, and surgical systems at the university of new south wales,  sydney, australia
content: dear all, phd positions in flexible mechatronics and soft robotics for wearable devices and surgical systems graduate school of biomedical engineering in collaboration with school of mechanical and manufacturing engineering, faculty of engineering, university of new south wales (unsw), sydney, australia is looking for several phd students (3.5-4 years) in projects related to surgical/medical robotics, haptics, and wearable devices starting in semester 3 (sept/2019) or semester 1 (feb/2020) with fully scholarship support including tuition fee and stipend. the deadline for the term 3 intake is 03/may/2019. project 1: flexible/surgical robots this project will focus on the mechanical design, fabrication, modelling, sensing, and control for novel generation miniature flexible robotic arms/catheters with advanced actuation and sensing technologies for flexible endoscopic systems. the robotic systems will also integrate real-time haptic displays to be used in gastrointestinal cancer treatments, heart, and other related diseases. clinical trials on living animals and human will be carried out at the end of the project. the successful candidates are expected to have strong skills and experiences on mechanical design, robotic and flexible mechatronic systems, control, and good hands-on with mechanical fabrication and prototypes, smart materials. this project will collaborate with leading researchers, surgeons, and experts from unsw, local hospitals, international partners. successful candidates should be highly self-motivated to pursue independent and interdisciplinary research. project 2: wearable devices and robotic applications this project will develop strong, multifunctional, and shape programmable soft actuators with embedded sensors for wearable devices and robotic systems to be used in healthcare, vr/ar, rehabilitation, haptics, entertainments, military, and industrial sectors. the successful candidates are expected to have experiences in mechanical design, wearable and embedded electronics, robotic and mechatronic systems, smart materials, and control with good hands-on skills in mechanical and soft material fabrications. this project will collaborate with leading researchers and experts from both australia and overseas. successful candidates should be highly self-motivated to pursue independent and interdisciplinary research. ------------------------------------------------------- minimum requirements:   *   a four-year bachelor's degree with honours class i from an australian institution or equivalent research qualification experience.   *   english tests: (ielts 6.5 with min. 6.0 in all skills; toefl ibt 90 (min. 23 in writing, 22 in reading, listening and speaking); pte academic 64 with min. 54 in each subtest.   *   hdr self-assessment tool: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__selfassessment.research.unsw.edu.au_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vdxpvyvxyppvqwllgfg7-npuii4nl-mzxz4trqzc6w&s=0ybx56iu8syd-llhxucwfuzd4bgrmcalldx_aop0heu&e= ------------------------------------------------------- details for scholarship please follow these link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.unsw.edu.au_international-2dresearch-2dscholarships&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vdxpvyvxyppvqwllgfg7-npuii4nl-mzxz4trqzc6w&s=g9iefq6ew6k1wll4ta5_0x50-jatsuvhnhpcmij6qms&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__research.unsw.edu.au_domestic-2dresearch-2dscholarships&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vdxpvyvxyppvqwllgfg7-npuii4nl-mzxz4trqzc6w&s=hqcmnksnuzjsmkhzmr-_sy09fvrv_rsqndfl7voxmfq&e= ------------------------------------------------------- applications: interested students are invited to send their applications with title: [jobs][name of project interest] to dr. thanh nho do via tn.do{at}unsw.edu.au and include: 1) cover letter with your detailed research interest (1-2 pages would be fine) 2) your cv with detailed experiences (previous and current projects, publications) and includes at least two academic references 3) summary (1-2 pages) of bachelor and/or master thesis 4) academic transcripts and certificates of degrees 5) soft copy of your publications if any (e.g. journals, conferences, thesis...) and links if any to illustration photos/videos, developed prototypes, website... 6) proof of english proficiency (toefl, ielts...) that meets minimum requirement from unsw (as above). ------------------------------------------------------- note: only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews. ------------------------------------------------------- additional supports: - in additional to unsw scholarships, a top-up allowance per year for 3.5-4 years will be provided for exceptional candidates. - annual travel funds for local/international conferences and to visit collaborators' labs in usa, singapore, and europe. ------------------------------------------------------- about unsw: unsw is one of the top three universities in australia and a research-intensive university ranked in the world's top 50 universities (qs rankings 2018). unsw has all great facilities and excellent staffs needed for world class research. unsw ranks 45th in the 2018 qs world university rankings, 85th in the 2018 times higher education world university rankings, and 36th in the world for academic reputation. unsw is a member of the prestigious group of eight australia's leading research-intensive universities and is australia's most comprehensive research-intensive university, one of only two in the world to be ranked in 50 subject areas in the shanghai ranking's global ranking of academic subjects 2017. the main unsw campus is located in the eastern suburbs of sydney only 7km from the centre of the city, 2km from coogee beach and 5km from sydney's international and domestic airports. about sydney: sydney is a great place to live and enjoy and one of the most beautiful, liveable and friendly cities in the world. the city is among the top fifteen most-visited cities in the world, with millions of tourists coming each year to see the city's landmarks with beautiful beaches and parks. boasting over 1,000,000 ha (2,500,000 acres) of nature reserves and parks, its notable natural features include sydney harbour, the royal national park, royal botanic garden and hyde park, the oldest parkland in the country. built attractions such as the sydney harbour bridge and the world heritage-listed sydney opera house are also well known to international visitors. sydney has an advanced market economy with strengths in finance, manufacturing and tourism. thank you very much. yours sincerely thanh nho do phd scientia lecturer graduate school of biomedical engineering, university of new south wales (unsw) sydney nsw 2052 australia

subject: post-doc wanted for semantic slam at  nanyang technological university
content: job description: 1.       research in the area of visual slam 2.       duration 10 months, 3.       must have a phd in this area 4.       salary: s$4k+ per month plus bonus; 5.       location: nanyang tech. university; singapore regards dr. wang han, associate professor school of eee, s2 nanyang technological university, singapore 639798 e-mail: hw at ntu.edu.sg<mailto:hw at ntu.edu.sg> tel.: (65) 6790-4506 fax: (65) 6792-0415 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www3.ntu.edu.sg_home_hw_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kopjnql8_j30dthq96yqfmuctpwozkmkhmx5dbsijrs&s=fpacws3uwt4tugbyz7fussohw6bautytewnmeyeei1y&e= ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: postdoc openings at hp-ntu corp lab,  singapore
content: dear colleagues, hp-ntu digital manufacturing corporate lab is a new joint lab between hp inc. and ntu. with a funding of $84 million, the lab will focus on digital manufacturing technologies, specifically in areas of advancing 3d printing, artificial intelligence, machine learning, new materials and applications, cybersecurity and customization. i am leading the robotics effort of the lab, looking into automating the full 3d printing pipeline, which comprises multiple steps such as picking, cleaning, assembling, polishing, painting, etc. 3d printed parts. i am looking for several postdoctoral researchers to drive this research effort, in the following broad fields: - robot perception (based or not on deep learning) - motion planning - robot control - manipulation detailed information on our previous work can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntu.edu.sg_home_cuong_&d=dwic-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nitbm5avx1rmroyetl8e6iqut05rhpsuvhyoy_jfcha&s=zgw7tjkevvvgfvvwxtikavpy63eyubcv_ohj1hxl1y4&e=. we publish regularly in major robotics venues (science robotics, ijrr, ieee tro, rss, icra, iros, etc.), and our research has been covered by major international media, including the new york times, the guardian, the economist, cnn, science, nature, etc. the successful applicants will be fully integrated in our team, while working in close collaboration with hp researchers and engineers based in singapore and palo alto, california. interested candidates are invited to send a cv and three of their most significant publications and/or software projects (e.g. github repo) to cuong at ntu.edu.sg. applications are reviewed immediately and until the positions are filled. if you are attending icra 2019 in montreal, don't hesitate to drop me an email to arrange a meeting during the conference. best regards, cuong --  quang-cuong pham www.normalesup.org/~pham www.ntu.edu.sg/home/cuong

subject: post doc positions at nanyang  technological university
content: job opening for postdoc research fellows in vision/machine learning/micromanipulation: the school of electrical and electronic engineering, nanyang technological university, singapore invites applications for several postdoc research fellow positions in the following areas: 1)      robot vision 2)      machine learning 3)      micro-manipulation applicants for the postdoc research fellow position should hold a ph.d degree in relevant areas; have a track record of research experience in terms of publications; have a good command of english and are able to communicate well. application procedure: suitably qualified candidates are invited to submit a cv, cover letter initially. short-listed candidates will be notified for submission of full application packages. electronic submission of application is encouraged and can be sent to: prof c. c. cheah email: ecccheah at ntu.edu.sg application closes when the positions are filled. only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview. ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: open robotics is hiring
content: tl;dr: we're hiring, in california and singapore. join us!   https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.openrobotics.org_careers-23bamboohr&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wlyki35iw-opdegh9zol882mgjat1e5oac_oi5k6axu&s=vs1bwaunjzn7rg-wasjwwmx4a49o78dc3uaqt3uubhw&e= at open robotics, we work with industry, academia, and government to create and support open software and hardware for use in robotics, from research and education to product development. we develop and maintain the core of the ros and gazebo. powered by the support of a global community, these tools are relied upon by hundreds of thousands of users and developers working with every type of robot imaginable. the unifying theme of our team and our work is openness. we use and we build open systems, and we foster an open source community that is at the heart of our projects. we are seeking motivated, friendly, collaborative individuals with an interest in robotics. direct experience with robotics is a plus, but not a requirement. all positions are preferred to be full-time and on site at one of our offices (mountain view, california or singapore). however, we are open to the possibility of part time and offsite opportunities. our current openings (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.openrobotics.org_careers-23bamboohr&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wlyki35iw-opdegh9zol882mgjat1e5oac_oi5k6axu&s=vs1bwaunjzn7rg-wasjwwmx4a49o78dc3uaqt3uubhw&e=) include: * open source evangelist * technical project manager * technical writer * software engineer: robotics (california and singapore) * software engineer: web : (california and singapore) we're also looking for excellent interns (though we're already full for summer 2019 in california): subject: research fellow position in control of  soft actuators and soft robots at national university of singapore in-reply-to: <sg2pr06mb3516862ff864065ba6336aabfe520@sg2pr06mb3516.apcprd06.prod.outlook.com> references: <sg2pr06mb3516862ff864065ba6336aabfe520@sg2pr06mb3516.apcprd06.prod.outlook.com>
content: research fellow in control of soft actuators and soft robots the department of mechanical engineering in the faculty of engineering at the national university of singapore (nus) has one opening for a research fellow with expertise in control of soft actuators/robots. application requirements: ? strong research background in control of robots, and/or control method/algorithm; ? excellent publication record, i.e., journal and/or conference publications on control of robots, and/or control method/algorithm. ? excellent communication skills; ? high creativity for independent work; ? a strong desire to work as part of a research team. salary and benefits will be commensurable with educational qualifications and working experience. applications, with full cv and a covering letter stating suitability for the post, are to be made electronically to associate prof. chew chee meng at email: chewcm at nus.edu.sg, and assistant prof zhu jian at email: mpezhuj at nus.edu.sg only shortlisted applicants will be notified. dr. wang yuzhe :: department of mechanical engineering :: faculty of engineering :: national university of singapore :: block e1 #02-01, 3 engineering drive 2, singapore 117578:: +65 81052164 (hp) :: mpewyz at nus.edu.sg<mailto:mpewyz at nus.edu.sg> (e) :: www.nus.edu.sg<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.nus.edu.sg_&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4q31jmxlx3csd1i_d3jjyrt44zdqerulqocdblui7fm&s=mwq-cyphttd9bdgdcmblhx5fdo2hpk3e_uzhdib3nme&e=> (w) :: company registration no: 200604346e ________________________________ important: this email is confidential and may be privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it and notify us immediately; you should not copy or use it for any purpose, nor disclose its contents to any other person. thank you.

subject: senior software engineer,  lionsbot singapore
content: senior software engineer, lionsbot singapore founded in february 2018, singapore-headquartered lionsbot international is poised to become the global brand leader in advanced, fully-autonomous, team-based cleaning robotics. offered to the international market on a ?service-based? business model, lionsbot?s range of professional and human-like cleaning robots combine the r&d acumen of a strong in-house design team with the latest cutting-edge cleaning technology from supersteam asia pacific. lionsbot?s corporate mission is to provide ?better cleaning with robotic technology, better living for billions?. further information about lionsbot may be found at www.lionsbot.com<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.lionsbot.com_&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=95x6cfza55yufm85tyv9mqwi_uesrnybouokpgzwifm&s=mzaajan9bmdtaejdo55hgjtfi6jvqh8mqxjntxwmczk&e=> we are looking for an energetic and innovative leader to spearhead our cloud application development and robotics solution integration. you will be coordinating a vibrant team of engineers towards developing and deploying cloud applications for our multiple families of cleaning robots. essential functions:   *   strong hands-on skills in application development and leadership experience in building cloud-based solutions.   *   provide technical advice, architect, design and develop cloud solutions working closely with the robotics hardware and autonomy teams.   *   deliver time critical milestone tagged to design, and development of cloud applications and services enabling our seamless and well satisfactory deployments of our cleaning robots connecting mobile robots with a strong emphasis on 24/7 availability and reliability.   *   actively contribute towards business and continuous performance improvements of our cloud services, functions, and features.   *   put in place real-time feedback mechanisms and health monitoring systems with state of the art security protocols to ensure security at all levels. qualifications:   *   bachelor or master of science/engineering degree in software engineering or computer science   *   experience architecting/designing cloud-based solutions solid cloud experience, preferably in amazon web services (aws)   *   experience with multiple data management/backend storage technologies   *   experience deploying, monitoring and maintaining production systems while ensuring availability and resilience   *   solid scripting skills (python, javascript, or similar)   *   understanding of security and data protection   *   familiarity with the commercial software development process with good software hygiene regarding code documentation, unit testing, bug tracking, and branch management.   *   highly-motivated team player with a strong track record of technical leadership and technical collaboration.   *   strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills with excellent oral and written communication skills. annual salary: sgd 100,000 to sgd 130,000 closing date: 30/04/2019 applications, with full cv and a covering letter stating suitability for the post, are to be emailed  to mohan at lionsbot.com<mailto:mohan at lionsbot.com> best regards, mohan assistant professor, singapore university of technology and design co-founder, lionsbot international email: mohan at lionsbot.com<mailto:mohan at lionsbot.com>; rajeshelara at sutd.edu.sg<mailto:rajeshelara at sutd.edu.sg>

subject: scientist position in tactile  perception and tactile-guided manipulation @ a*star, singapore in-reply-to: <hk0pr01mb29463e6cef90ffbb76e03635be630@hk0pr01mb2946.apcprd01.prod.exchangelabs.com> references: <hk0pr01mb29463e6cef90ffbb76e03635be630@hk0pr01mb2946.apcprd01.prod.exchangelabs.com>
content: the robotics and autonomous systems department at the a*star institute for infocomm research, singapore, invites application for a research scientist position in tactile perception and tactile-guided manipulation. we offer a highly competitive remuneration, leave and welfare package which commensurate with the experience of each applicant. details on each position can be found below. applications will be reviewed until the positions are filled. interested applicants are requested to submit: - a cover letter - a curriculum vitae that includes the name and contact information of 2 referees to wuy(at)i2r.a-star.edu.sg as soon as possible. shortlisted candidates will be notified through email for interview. ============================================================================ job description successful candidate will be involved in some or all of the following tasks: - research and development of multimodal active perceptual and learning algorithms for environmental understanding and safe and agile object manipulation with a focus on using event-based high-resolution tactile sensory inputs - system integration to deliver functioning modules in a collaborative industrial robot environment - actively collaborate with other researchers in scientific writing, testing, experimentations, and trouble-shootings the robots during testing and real-world trial deployments - closely collaborate with other researchers to conduct research on robotic affordance understanding, grasping and perception, including tactile perception technology to create new robotic capabilities - realisation of algorithms developed into computational footprints that are suitable for deployment in robots, including optimizing the algorithms to allow for real time processing or deployment in an embedded processor - support the research and development activities of the department in robot learning and dexterity job requirements - phd in computer science or electrical, electronics, computer, mechanical or mechatronics engineering - background in relevant robotics field - proficient in programming skills (c/c++ and/or python) - strong research track record - good analytical skills, innovative and proven track record in solving problems encountered in projects that are relevant to robotics - good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills ============================================================================ about us the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) is singapore's lead public sector agency that fosters world-class scientific research and talent to drive economic growth and transform singapore into a vibrant knowledge-based and innovation driven economy.  for more information about a*star, please visit: www.a-star.edu.sg<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.a-2dstar.edu.sg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=1ydy6crvqsv-plihn0wlq9kzrohtc8sl_d-c0seodea&s=zjbf6tu6yaw5jokdnk8zyypv6vwkdc-rmywhkplevli&e=> the institute for infocomm research (i?r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore's largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.a-star.edu.sg/i2r best wishes, yan this e-mail and any attachments are only for the use of the intended recipient and may contain material that is confidential, privileged and/or protected by the official secrets act. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it or notify the sender immediately. please do not copy or use it for any purpose or disclose the contents to any other person.

subject: enway is looking for talented engineers
content: autonomous city services will make living in cities better and will free humans from carrying out repetitive and dangerous tasks. at enway we build the software that enables machines to do these tasks autonomously. we are starting with the software solution for autonomous sweeping - where we make sweeping much more efficient, flexible, and reliable. on this path to autonomous city services, we are working to establish autonomous sweeping in controlled private ground environments, such as factories, waste management facilities, and warehouses. we are also working on establishing autonomous sweeping in cities on public grounds. we already have commercially deployed autonomous sweeping robots at customer sites. we are integrating our technology into the series production of leading sweeper vehicle manufacturers. join us and play a critical role in our mission: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=b8xe6renpoahhpq3paboyn1t11tesvs4fvjerdzbzos&s=iglbiyzjxxjrt8ygt1iocfi3xfrdum12inwl9cirkse&e= *our open positions in berlin, germany:*    - subject: opening for full-time research  associate, nanyang technological university, singapore
content: the robotics research centre in the school of mechanical and aerospace engineering at the nanyang technological university (ntu), singapore is seeking a full time research associate for a project regarding the development of robotic solutions for food industries. this project is a close collaboration among ntu, nus, sutd and a*star. the successful applicant will have the opportunity to learn from and contribute to a distinguished team of researchers and industrial partners.   position: - full time research associate/engineer for computer vision and machine learning in robotic applications. the candidate will assist the team on the project developing software for object recognition, with specific emphasis on food items which can vary to some degree in shape, colour and size. this candidate will also assist the team to interface the developed vision module with the overall robotic system, as well as guide staff and students in his/her area of expertise.    the candidate is expected to have a masters degree in computer engineering/electrical engineering or a related discipline, with experience in c++, python, and ros. this candidate is expected to have extensive knowledge of computer vision and machine learning software techniques. experience in mechatronic or robotic systems will be an significant advantage. the candidate should have a strong command of written and spoken english. this person must be capable of initiative, driven, and a team player. the appointment is for 2 years with immediate hiring. the commencing salary will depend on the candidate?s qualification and experience. principal investigator: professor i-ming chen (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.ntu.edu.sg_home_michen_index.html&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=72qvzevpyjmbzu9ofns9r-tomg_qekd3ms_5l8o596w&s=zhfwsck1xfof0zc-iq0olfhfbim_zbmo28z2ajma_54&e= ).   applicants can send their resumes and cv to: dr choon yue wong school of mechanical and aerospace engineering nanyang technological university 50 nanyang avenue, singapore 639798 email: wongcy at ntu.edu.sg -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=72qvzevpyjmbzu9ofns9r-tomg_qekd3ms_5l8o596w&s=mwi2ha_aqhlqgvsivmfvlxnfzimgrpqhjglfbloqlwg&e=

subject: post doc position in micro-manipulation  at nanyang technological university
content: the nanyang technological university, singapore invites applications for one postdoctoral research fellow position to participate in the development of  robotic dexterous and bimanual micro-manipulation techniques. applicants for the postdoc research fellow position should hold a ph.d degree in one or more of the following areas: 1)      micro-manipulation 2)      dextrous manipulation 3)      cooperative control the applications should have a track record of competitive research experience in terms of journal publications and have a good command of english and are able to communicate well. application procedure: suitably qualified candidates are invited to submit a cv, cover letter initially. short-listed candidates will be notified for submission of full application packages. electronic submission of application is encouraged and can be sent to: prof c. c. cheah school of electrical & electronic engineering nanyang technological university 50 nanyang avenue block s1 singapore 639798 e-mail address for e-mailed applications: ecccheah at ntu.edu.sg application closes when the position is filled. only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview. ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: phd,  post-doc and research associate positions at ntu, singapore (dino accoto)
content: the robotics research centre at nanyang technological university (ntu, singapore; prof. dino accoto) invites applications for the following open positions:  - phd students (application deadline: july 31, 2019)  - research associate (deadline: june 24, 2019)  - post-doctoral research fellow (deadline: june 24, 2019) targeted research areas - advanced human-robot interfaces with ai capabilities; - assistive autonomous and wearable robots with ai capabilities. requirements - proficiency in at least one programming language; - experience in mechatronic design (commensurate to the position); - for post-doc: proven capability to undertake high level research with a great autonomy level and experience in drafting high quality research papers. previous experience in machine learning, even in fields different from robotics, will be positively considered. duties responsibilities will depend from the role, profile and seniority of the candidate, and may include one or more of the following: development and experimental testing of novel software or hardware sub-systems according to specific project plans; technical reporting; contributing to paper preparation; assisting in research proposal drafting; supporting the supervision of undergraduate projects. salary and workplace one of ntu's greatest assets is diversity in terms of nationality, ethnicity, and culture. ntu offers an internationalized environment in the multicultural singapore. attractive salaries are commensurate to the role/experience of the candidate, and in line with those of the major international universities worldwide. about the re.botics lab, embedded in the robotics research centre at ntu, pursuits research in robotics adopting a holistic approach for the development of novel and diverse machines for the human well-being, both for work and life. targeted applications include: medical robots (e.g. for diagnosis, therapy and rehabilitation) and assistive/augmenting robots (e.g. for manual workers, elderly and disabled people). the holistic approach refers to any part or subsystem of the robot, such as mechanics, sensors, actuators, control, and intelligence, being designed having in mind the final objective of optimizing the system as a whole. also research in design methodologies and fabrication technologies is pursued adopting soft robotics, embodied intelligence, multiscale and multiphysics approaches. how to apply interested candidates are invited to email to prof. dino accoto (daccoto at ntu.edu.sg<mailto:daccoto at ntu.edu.sg>): - curriculum vitae; - a max 2 pages letter describing: i) motivation; ii) professional expectations; iii) research experience and research interests; - contact details of at least two referrers available to be contacted upon request, shortlisted candidates will be notified by june 28, 2019. ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: 4-year joint phd position in robotics  (university of liverpool and a*star, singapore), uk/eu students only
content: one 4-year joint phd position at the university of liverpool, uk, and a*star, singapore. (uk/eu students only) the student will conduct research at the university of liverpool in the first and the last year of the phd project, and the middle two years at a*star, singapore. the student should have a 2:1 or better, and be uk/eu citizen. research topic: the project will develop deep neural models to embed multimodal information for robot tasks like grasping and manipulation. the proposed system has potential to be applied in the factories of the future, especially in the autonomous warehouse environments. start date: 24th may 2019. candidate requirements: we are looking for candidates with an upper-second class degree or international equivalent<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bristol.ac.uk_international_countries_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hljwe437lv7dq0kjqtqb-re_319ryzfk-5uoo2k0vga&s=293sqozetvzwck4qsy_7mgxisnvuobrmxxmcnlj2ehg&e=> in computer science, robotics, engineering, physics, mathematics or related subject. other disciplines will be considered on a case-by-case basis. funding: we have scholarships available for uk and eu students at standard ukri rate. how to apply: please make an online application for this phd at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.liverpool.ac.uk_study_postgraduate-2dresearch_how-2dto-2dapply_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hljwe437lv7dq0kjqtqb-re_319ryzfk-5uoo2k0vga&s=r7tqcryvcmftm07yxmsdwwpwvtfkvlfnxox-ny-qtjk&e=<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bris.ac.uk_pg-2dhowtoapply&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hljwe437lv7dq0kjqtqb-re_319ryzfk-5uoo2k0vga&s=gq-rzmfekyexdv__fhsfcb-ogwjebkxr4fwllt2ijsu&e=>. it is advised to contact dr shan luo on potential research topics first. deadline: 18th february 2019 contacts: dr shan luo (shan.luo at liverpool.ac.uk<mailto:shan.luo at liverpool.ac.uk>) and dr yan wu (wuy at i2r.a-star.edu.sg) ------------------------------------- dr. shan luo lecturer (assistant professor) in robotics director of the smartlab<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__wordpress.csc.liv.ac.uk_smartlab_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hljwe437lv7dq0kjqtqb-re_319ryzfk-5uoo2k0vga&s=woqz9sm_nbppodp2l7qt9tmcqhl7ffidze0hf0lp3a8&e=> subject: scientist position and phd scholarships  in multimodal perception and manipulation @ a*star, singapore in-reply-to: <sg2pr01mb2949b755c7224d0628f689e5be070@sg2pr01mb2949.apcprd01.prod.exchangelabs.com> references: <sg2pr01mb2949b755c7224d0628f689e5be070@sg2pr01mb2949.apcprd01.prod.exchangelabs.com>
content: [informal chat can be arranged at icra conference site] the robotics and autonomous systems department at the a*star institute for infocomm research, singapore, invites application for1)  a research scientist position and 2) phd applicants (including joint programme with uk/eu universities) in multimodal perception and manipulation. we offer a highly competitive remuneration, leave and welfare package which commensurate with the experience of each applicant. details on each position can be found below. applications will be reviewed until the positions are filled. interested applicants are requested to submit: - a cover letter - a curriculum vitae that includes the name and contact information of 2 referees to wuy(at)i2r.a-star.edu.sg as soon as possible. shortlisted candidates will be notified through email for interview. ============================================================================ job description successful candidate will be involved in some or all of the following tasks: - research and development of multimodal active perceptual and learning algorithms for environmental understanding and safe and agile object manipulation with a focus on using event-based high-resolution tactile sensory inputs - system integration to deliver functioning modules in a collaborative industrial robot environment - actively collaborate with other researchers in scientific writing, testing, experimentations, and trouble-shootings the robots during testing and real-world trial deployments - closely collaborate with other researchers to conduct research on robotic affordance understanding, grasping and perception, including tactile perception technology to create new robotic capabilities - realisation of algorithms developed into computational footprints that are suitable for deployment in robots, including optimizing the algorithms to allow for real time processing or deployment in an embedded processor - support the research and development activities of the department in robot learning and dexterity job requirements scientist position - phd in computer science or electrical, electronics, computer, mechanical or mechatronics engineering - background in relevant robotics field - proficient in programming skills (c/c++ and/or python) - strong research track record - good analytical skills, innovative and proven track record in solving problems encountered in projects that are relevant to robotics - good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills phd student - upper 2nd class (or equivalent) in bachelor's degrees in computer science or electrical, electronics, computer, mechanical, mechatronics engineering or related field - proficient in programming skills (c/c++ and/or python) - research track record in robotics or related fields is an added advantage - good analytical skills, innovative and proven track record in solving problems encountered in projects that are relevant to robotics - good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills ============================================================================ about us the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) is singapore's lead public sector agency that fosters world-class scientific research and talent to drive economic growth and transform singapore into a vibrant knowledge-based and innovation driven economy.  for more information about a*star, please visit: www.a-star.edu.sg<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.a-2dstar.edu.sg&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hsw-lq99-jbtiv6_hzanvufqcfxwmkyrqxr81x8skxu&s=p6avn-ohircvaf6edr9bvozry2a-oargqm5hbewlxuu&e=> the institute for infocomm research (i?r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore's largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.a-star.edu.sg/i2r<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.a-2dstar.edu.sg_i2r&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hsw-lq99-jbtiv6_hzanvufqcfxwmkyrqxr81x8skxu&s=ceikee1ggznpzw_iqodfhu_q8lmtihj9dtmqq34k4lo&e=> best wishes, yan this e-mail and any attachments are only for the use of the intended recipient and may contain material that is confidential, privileged and/or protected by the official secrets act. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it or notify the sender immediately. please do not copy or use it for any purpose or disclose the contents to any other person.

subject: post doc positions at nanyang  technological university
content: the nanyang technological university, singapore invites applications for a postdoctoral research fellow position to participate in the development of an intelligent robot system for construction inspection and progress monitoring. applicants for the postdoc research fellow position should hold a ph.d degree in one or more of the following areas: 1)      robot vision 2)      intelligent sensing/control 3)      mobile robot control the candidates should have a track record of competitive research experience in terms of journal publications and have a good command of english and are able to communicate well. application procedure: suitably qualified candidates are invited to submit a cv, cover letter initially. short-listed candidates will be notified for submission of full application packages. electronic submission of application is encouraged and can be sent to: prof c. c. cheah school of electrical & electronic engineering nanyang technological university 50 nanyang avenue block s1 singapore 639798 e-mail address for e-mailed applications: ecccheah at ntu.edu.sg application closes when the position is filled. only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview. ________________________________ confidentiality: this email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents. towards a sustainable earth: print only when necessary. thank you.

subject: opening for full-time research  associate, nanyang technological university, singapore in-reply-to: <1556516183223-0.post@n5.nabble.com> references: <1556516183223-0.post@n5.nabble.com>
content: the robotics research centre in the school of mechanical and aerospace  engineering at the nanyang technological university (ntu), singapore is  seeking a full time research associate for a project regarding the  development of robotic solutions for food industries. this project is a  close collaboration among ntu, nus, sutd and a*star. the successful  applicant will have the opportunity to learn from and contribute to a  distinguished team of researchers and industrial partners.     position: - full time research associate/engineer for computer vision and  machine learning in robotic applications. the candidate will assist the team  on the project developing software for object recognition, with specific  emphasis on food items which can vary to some degree in shape, colour and  size. this candidate will also assist the team to interface the developed  vision module with the overall robotic system, as well as guide staff and  students in his/her area of expertise.     the candidate is expected to have a masters degree in computer  engineering/electrical engineering or a related discipline, with experience  in c++, python, and ros. this candidate is expected to have extensive  knowledge of computer vision and machine learning software techniques.  experience in mechatronic or robotic systems will be an significant  advantage. the candidate should have a strong command of written and spoken  english. this person must be capable of initiative, driven, and a team  player. the appointment is for 2 years with immediate hiring. the commencing  salary will depend on the candidate?s qualification and experience.  principal investigator: professor i-ming chen  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__research.ntu.edu.sg_expertise_academicprofile_pages_staffprofile.aspx-3fst-5femailid-3dmichen&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=g7qflwxhv-rvgbd1x8lni-ztilphsxe_2j0xp7zbzvo&s=svnfiw9sh8ns-e0l-iax06zf1xp11r7ztbduopx4yle&e=     applicants can send their resumes and cv to:  dr choon yue wong  school of mechanical and aerospace engineering  nanyang technological university  50 nanyang avenue, singapore 639798  email: wongcy at ntu.edu.sg -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=g7qflwxhv-rvgbd1x8lni-ztilphsxe_2j0xp7zbzvo&s=ssnqqefht6pjet9yn-xzccetabyfnvqv79fj5lf3brk&e=

subject: two fully-funded phd positions on  advanced 4d printing and microrobotics for uk/eu nationals starting in  september 2019
content: two fully-funded 4-year phd positions are available for uk/eu nationals  starting in the end of september 2019. cv submission closing date: monday, 22.07.2019. the department of automatic control and systems engineering at the  university of sheffield (uk), the agency for science, technology and  research (a*star, singapore), nanyang technological university (ntu,  singapore), and singapore university of technology and design (sutd,  singapore), jointly invite applications for two 4-year funded phd  scholarships open to uk and eu applicants. the programme will start in  september 2019. the prestigious a*star-sheffield scheme gives the phd students the  unique opportunity to carry out part of their studies in singapore as  part of a partnership agreement with a*star. the prospective phd  students will start her/his career either in uk or singapore. after two  years, the students will move to the other side and continue/complete  the work. when completion, the phd degree will be awarded by the  university of sheffield. position 1: microrobots for advanced manufacturing and healthcare https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.sheffield.ac.uk_acse_research-2ddegrees_phd-2dopportunities_microrobots-2d1.846274&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovzpcwxfuv_krh_sp5yd-6efyb7ojnz7jhfrh6qlyag&s=7rezogcxey-v0kwxfcqsntrsbktijm5dgasgauglrqk&e= position 2: advanced 4d printing for robotics, manufacturing, and  healthcare https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.sheffield.ac.uk_acse_research-2ddegrees_phd-2dopportunities_printing-2d4d-2drobotics-2dmanufacturing-2d1.846265&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovzpcwxfuv_krh_sp5yd-6efyb7ojnz7jhfrh6qlyag&s=ler1xra7jy6k3cckui_nem08j5lbrwu4v7bxtinnmmq&e= eligibility and requirements residency restrictions - awards are open to uk and eu applicants only. candidates are expected to have a background in one of the following  fields: mechanical engineering, robotics, chemical engineering,  biomedical engineering, materials science, robotics, mems, control,  electrical engineering, or a related field. applicants with other qualifications or experience should contact the  department?s research support officer <phdacse at sheffield.ac.uk> so that  we can check on your eligibility. dual-career academic couple is welcome to apply. application please send your cv to dr shuhei miyashita  <shuhei.miyashita at sheffield.ac.uk> with a cover paragraph stating your  interests and suitability for the role. please indicate/confirm within this message, if you meet our minimum  english language requirements, and provide evidence of this: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.sheffield.ac.uk_acse_research-2ddegrees_applyphd&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovzpcwxfuv_krh_sp5yd-6efyb7ojnz7jhfrh6qlyag&s=io87rcfpb8-kftlubh3wyubzz8dw5jc6lomhmfpdebg&e= closing date: monday, 22.07.2019. we highly encourage applicants to  apply in advance of this date. this is because we will require  shortlisted applicants to submit a formal application which will require  a set of official documents to be uploaded, which may take time to prepare. shortlisted candidates will be contacted to submit a formal application  shortly after the initial closing date, with instructions on how to  submit this formal application via the university's online application  system (which must be completed by monday 5 august 2019). funding notes the studentship provides funding for 4 years. while in singapore, a*star  will provide financial support including a living allowance, a one-off  ?settling-in allowance?, a one-time airfare allowance, consumables and  bench fees, cost of medical insurance. while in sheffield, the  scholarship covers tuition fees and pays a stipend at the uk rate  (?15,009 per annum). the university of sheffield is a member of the russell group of leading  uk research universities. the university is rated 75th in world in the  2019 qs world university rankings. in the times higher education student  experience survey 2018, the university was voted top five nationally for  providing the best overall student experience, with our students' union  voted best in the uk for the tenth year in a row. nanyang technological university (ntu) is ranked 12th globally by the  2019 qs world university rankings, and is also placed 1st amongst the  world?s best young universities. the university offers a high-quality  global education to undergraduate and postgraduate students. you will  enjoy a host of opportunities for research collaboration within ntu, and  with world-leading universities and renowned institutes. singapore university of technology and design (sutd) is the 4th  autonomous university in singapore. sutd offers an integrated  multi-disciplinary curriculum and multi-disciplinary research with a  focus on design and key engineering sectors (advanced manufacturing,  healthcare, aviation and cities). institute of materials research and engineering (imre) is a research  institute of the science and engineering research council (serc), agency  for science, technology and research (a*star). established in september  1997, imre has been building strong capabilities in materials analysis,  characterisation, design & growth, patterning, fabrication, synthesis  and integration. imre is an institute of talented researchers equipped  with state-of-the-art facilities to conduct world-class materials  science research to improve lives and capture economic value for singapore. the advanced remanufacturing and technology centre (artc) is a  contemporary platform built upon strong public-private partnerships. the  artc is led by the agency for science, technology and research (a*star),  in partnership with the nanyang technological university (ntu). artc has  a membership consortium with over 65 members, ranging from global  multinational corporations (mncs) to small and medium enterprises  (smes). artc focuses on advanced manufacturing and remanufacturing and  serves to accelerate the transfer of innovation from applied research to  industrial applications. best regards, shuhei miyashita https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__sites.google.com_site_shuheidotnet_home&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovzpcwxfuv_krh_sp5yd-6efyb7ojnz7jhfrh6qlyag&s=koarenseegcq106mhy_at3fjd3k-c3tw-a5iabejgwy&e= --  *shuhei miyashita, ph.d.* lecturer, university of sheffield automatic control and systems engineering department amy johnson bld, portobello ln, sheffield, s1 3jd, uk shuhei.miyashita at sheffield.ac.uk | +44 (0)114 2225662 | https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__shuhei.net_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovzpcwxfuv_krh_sp5yd-6efyb7ojnz7jhfrh6qlyag&s=rxesi2dmdstbbb4qhhe3du6a6wslnftsh1romsrsrec&e=

subject: robotics oppertunities at dyson
content: apologies for any cross posting dear all, dyson is growing fast and investing for an ambitious future in robotics. we currently have a number of open positions across dyson in research, new product innovation and new product development based both in malmesbury in the uk and singapore. topics of interest include: *         design engineering *         software engineering *         computer vision *         machine learning *         manipulation *         human-robot interaction *         high level robot behaviour *         project management *         motor and power systems design please use the link below to view the open positions (you may want to filter the list by location): https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__careers.dyson.com_en-2dgb_search-2dresults_-3fq-3drobot-26page-3d2-26minpage-3d1-26maxpage-3d2-26sort-3dscore&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=oxzcnijdxziehfhx_kn6o8jhkslsrtyrslh0zggzjfi&s=mtamipqojg27kvtugpajsmnzwohlg_jvylk7ud2mnfs&e=  we're also attending a number of conferences this year including rss, humanoids, corl, iros, and roscon. feel free to have a chat with us there! best. robin. ------------------------------------------------------- dr. robin read senior robotics engineer dyson technology ltd. 1 tetbury hill, malmesbury, wiltshire, sn16 0rp dyson technology limited, company number 01959090, tetbury hill, malmesbury, sn16 0rp, uk. this message is intended solely for the addressee and may contain confidential information. if you have received this message in error, please immediately and permanently delete it, and do not use, copy or disclose the information contained in this message or in any attachment. dyson may monitor email traffic data and content for security & training.

subject: enway is looking for talented engineers
content: autonomous city services will make living in cities better and will free humans from carrying out repetitive and dangerous tasks. at enway we build the software that enables machines to do these tasks autonomously. we are starting with the software solution for autonomous sweeping - where we make sweeping much more efficient, flexible, and reliable. on this path to autonomous city services, we are working to establish autonomous sweeping in controlled private ground environments, such as factories, waste management facilities, and warehouses. we are also working on establishing autonomous sweeping in cities on public grounds. we already have commercially deployed autonomous sweeping robots at customer sites. we are integrating our technology into the series production of leading sweeper vehicle manufacturers. join us and play a critical role in our mission: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=w9xw1dfjehd34tfdbwhtvlhae1rb3bzcjvwer9w7zrc&e=  *our open positions in berlin, germany:*    - field deployment engineer (f/m/d):    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_field-2ddeployment-2dengineer-2dfmd&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=cjate2my8d30uux_c9xnofxhgzrdyonaywrvexcd8qg&e=     - robotics hardware & electrical engineering lead (f/m/d):    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_robotics-2dhardware-2delectrical-2dengineering-2dlead-2dfmd&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=mlgloxhssfsa8eqfazhx-glllo43zvvfp2ufktpvxzi&e=     - general robotics engineer (f/m/d):    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_general-2drobotics-2dengineer-2dfmd&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=uytyrnryziytuhk3yffw0pit1onqhy3ydze86flb3jk&e=  *our open positions in singapore:*    - general robotics engineer (f/m/d):    https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_general-2drobotics-2dengineer-2dfmd-2d1&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_prsmi_pj1gd5vqvcfjxxsve_lckci3l_8ecv4jca9m&s=upu6xz6_05g3ex7mytejpf5hz8pr46wxdc54rfpvpe0&e=

subject: enway is looking for a robotics  hardware lead
content: autonomous city services will make living in cities better and will free humans from carrying out repetitive and dangerous tasks. at enway we drive the path to autonomous city services by equipping hardware 'made in germany', with the software that enables machines to do such tasks autonomously. for now, our solutions focus on autonomous sweeping - where we make sweeping much more efficient, flexible, and reliable. we have already successfully deployed autonomous sweeping robots in controlled private ground environments at various customer sites throughout germany and are also partnering with the city of singapore to introduce autonomous sweeping to public places. we provide a robotic system that is reliable, high quality, safe, and user-friendly. enway is now looking for a robotics hardware lead who will work at the intersection of hardware and software and will lead the integration of our technology into the serial production of leading sweeper vehicle manufacturers. join a rapidly growing deep-tech startup in berlin with a highly motivated, result-oriented, international, world-class team by applying here today: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__careers.enway.ai_o_robotics-2dhardware-2dlead-2dfmd&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nvn2gqk5r1g4kndq_kwwyyesguyjy8uqxccmg-bt-s0&s=xqkmox-7nbntpunpccvn6d4lnifuflghyx3nnj5dlwi&e=  *about the role*    - you will be responsible for all hardware and electronics related    innovation and developments in the context of retrofitting our vehicles    - you will own the ramp-up and transition of our production to a    manufacturer in the context of our efforts to move to serial production    - you will manage a team of talented, dedicated and highly motivated    hardware and electronics engineers    - you will own our relations with key hardware vendors and suppliers    - you will have a hand in nearly every component of a sophisticated    autonomous system and will be responsible for its ce certification *our offer*    - flexible working hours    - employee stock participation    - highly competitive salary    - lunch, fitness, laptop and other perks    - vibrant and innovative working environment    - flat hierarchies and freedom to express and implement your idea *job requirements*    - university degree in mechanical engineering, mechatronics, electrical    engineering, robotics or similar    - extensive experiences in mechanical cad and designing electrical    systems    - interdisciplinary knowledge (mechanics, electronics, embedded    software) of and extensive experience in building mechatronic systems    - working experience with hardware products involving material science &    manufacturing, digital & analog electronics, micro controllers & sensors    - fluency in english and german    - a strategic mind paired with a hands-on attitude (drilling, soldering,    crimping, etc.)    - experience with regards to electrical safety standards (emi, esd, ce)    - team management experience as well as ramp up experience with robotics    systems would be idea    - willingness to relocate to berlin

subject: fully-funded phd position on  microrobotics for uk/eu nationals
content: one fully funded 4-year phd position is available for uk/eu nationals. research area: microrobotics commencement of program: september 2019. cv submission closing date: monday, 22.07.2019. this position is jointly offered by the department of automatic control and systems engineering at the university of sheffield (uk), the agency for science, technology and research (a*star, singapore), nanyang technological university (ntu, singapore). in this program, the phd student will have the opportunity to carry out his/her studies in sheffield as well as in singapore (a*star and ntu). the prospective phd student can start his/her career either in uk or singapore. after two years, the student will move to the other side and complete the work. upon completion, the phd degree will be awarded by the university of sheffield. the details of this position can be found via this hyperlink: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.sheffield.ac.uk_acse_research-2ddegrees_phd-2dopportunities_microrobots-2d1.846274&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovzpcwxfuv_krh_sp5yd-6efyb7ojnz7jhfrh6qlyag&s=7rezogcxey-v0kwxfcqsntrsbktijm5dgasgauglrqk&e= eligibility and requirements residency restrictions - awards are open to uk and eu applicants only.  candidates are expected to have a background in one of the following  fields: mechanical engineering, robotics, chemical engineering,  biomedical engineering, materials science, robotics, mems, control, electrical engineering, or a related field. applicants with other qualifications or experience should contact the department?s research support officer <phdacse at sheffield.ac.uk> so that we can check on your eligibility. dual-career academic couple is welcome to apply. application please send your cv to dr shuhei miyashita <shuhei.miyashita at sheffield.ac.uk> with a cover paragraph stating your interests and suitability for the role. please indicate/confirm within this message, if you meet our minimum  english language requirements, and provide evidence of this: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.sheffield.ac.uk_acse_research-2ddegrees_applyphd&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovzpcwxfuv_krh_sp5yd-6efyb7ojnz7jhfrh6qlyag&s=io87rcfpb8-kftlubh3wyubzz8dw5jc6lomhmfpdebg&e= closing date: monday, 22.07.2019. we highly encourage applicants to apply in advance of this date. this is because we will require shortlisted applicants to submit a formal application which will require a set of official documents to be uploaded, which may take time to prepare. shortlisted candidates will be contacted to submit a formal application shortly after the initial closing date, with instructions on how to submit this formal application via the university's online application  system (which must be completed by monday 5 august 2019).  funding notes the studentship provides funding for 4 years. while in singapore, a*star will provide financial support including a living allowance, a one-off ?settling-in allowance?, a one-time airfare allowance, consumables and bench fees, cost of medical insurance. while in sheffield, the scholarship covers tuition fees and pays a stipend at the uk rate (?15,009 per annum). the university of sheffield is a member of the russell group of leading uk research universities. the university is rated 75th in world in the 2019 qs world university rankings. in the times higher education student experience survey 2018, the university was voted top five nationally for providing the best overall student experience, with our students' union voted best in the uk for the tenth year in a row. nanyang technological university (ntu) is ranked 11th globally by the 2020 qs world university rankings, and is also placed 1st amongst the world?s best young universities. the university offers a high-quality global education to undergraduate and postgraduate students. you will enjoy a host of opportunities for research collaboration within ntu, and with world-leading universities and renowned institutes. the advanced remanufacturing and technology centre (artc) is a contemporary platform built upon strong public-private partnerships. the artc is led by the agency for science, technology and research (a*star), in partnership with the nanyang technological university (ntu). artc has  a membership consortium with over 65 members, ranging from global multinational corporations (mncs) to small and medium enterprises (smes). artc focuses on advanced manufacturing and remanufacturing and serves to accelerate the transfer of innovation from applied research to  industrial applications. best regards, guo zhan lum, ph.d. assistant professor, nanyang technological university  -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dcmgduvjudhpmeijpzh3sxaqk2opfp7_ekr2wdujmwg&s=uqpjmytxjwvvom5jjqav1ey48ils0l4jrwxxuvazppa&e=

subject: postdoctoral research fellow in tactile  perception
content: the computer science department at national university of singapore (nus) is seeking a motivated postdoctoral research fellow with expertise in robotics and machine learning, starting immediately. we aim to develop new deep learning techniques for fast, efficient perception with next-generation artificial skin on robots.  requirements:  * completed all requirements for a phd degree. a solid track record of publications at major ai, ml and robotics conferences is strongly preferred.  * expertise in robotics and/or machine learning is required.  * experience in tactile learning and physical human-robot-interaction, is a plus.  how to apply :  to apply for this position, please send your cv to harold soh at harold at comp.nus.edu.sg <mailto:harold at comp.nus.edu.sg> with a cover letter and a brief statement of previous work and research interests. the initial term of appointment will be 1 year extensible for another year upon review of satisfactory performance.  the selected candidates will be offered excellent salaries and benefits. nus is a world-class university that provides an outstanding and a supportive research environment. singapore is a vibrant city with low taxes and a research hub in asia.

dear robotics-worldwide, we are from advanced remanufacturing and technology centre (artc). based on a contemporary business model of public-private partnership, the centre transforms remanufacturing and manufacturing research into industry ready solutions for cross-sectoral industry members by bringing together best-in-class global companies and r&d minds in singapore. currently, the artc works with 70 industry members to develop advanced remanufacturing and manufacturing capabilities. the members are comprised of global mncs, leading equipment and software providers as well as smes. attached are the job descriptions of the roles that are currently vacant. thank you! ?? with regards, hidayah this e-mail and any attachments are only for the use of the intended recipient and may contain material that is confidential, privileged and/or protected by the official secrets act. if you are not the intended recipient, please delete it or notify the sender immediately. please do not copy or use it for any purpose or disclose the contents to any other person.

subject: hand plus robotics : mechanical engineer
content: mechanical engineer in hand plus robotics (singapore) hand plus robotics is seeking talented mechanical engineers to join a multidisciplinary product development team with diverse background. the role will primarily consist of designing robot structure and sensor modules, analyzing machine structure, doing industrial design, designing electronics and electrical connection of the robot system and leading the fabrication of the robot. roles and responsibilities: ? leading/conducting the robot mechanical system design and defining mechanical specifications ? designing parts for sensor modules and related motor control system for the instruments ? designing the electronics and electrical connection of the robot ? leading/conducting the fabrication, assembly and integration of the different parts of the robot ? analyzing the mechanical properties of the robots such as force tolerance, stability, etc ? documenting systems and processes in the form of technical reports and product manuals job requirements: ? bachelor or master's degree in related discipline with 3-5 years of relevant experience ? proficiency in me design tools autocad, solidworks, etc. ? familiar with me design process from prototyping, tooling or sheet metal fabrication, and testing ? hands-on experience on machining and motion system design ? knowledge or previous experience on id design is preferred ? good team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills and possession of entrepreneurial attitude application procedure: for interested applicants, please send your cv (in pdf format) to contact at handplusrobotics.com and an interview will be conducted for each profile fitting the requirement. we encourage applicants from other disciplines. we welcome student who wants to have a unique internship experience in a robotics company. about hand plus robotics: hand plus robotics is a university spin-off start-up company in singapore. hand plus builds robotic picking systems for logistics, manufacturing, hospitality and healthcare industries through its app+ software platform. hand plus is a young, dynamic and evolving company and offers opportunities for growth and learning in bringing technology from lab to market. learn more about us at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__handplusrobotics.com&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ptmzemmm6ur9gow7eg61ghjkmpt_0tk_f3scmqrkt0w&s=h6yujjuwtmvxg7_bjifpwawoxrlkj2y6-yrfa89uoac&e=  -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ptmzemmm6ur9gow7eg61ghjkmpt_0tk_f3scmqrkt0w&s=mp1c5uj4m3dfcvxjmrsec1jgw3y0ktg6f-n6p3fon7q&e=

subject: ultiple positions (postdoc and research  engineer) develop insect-computer hybrid robots
content: positions we are a research group of nanyang technological university, singapore. we develop insect-computer hybrid robots for search and rescue. you can check more about our group here:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__hirosatontu.wordpress.com_media-2dreports_&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hvb6yc0afr0prix27didhbsb1_rdnkep_gzcswpqn3a&s=cu28efsn-ofoqh4kedykctgxp99cyrwppqxy4hf7f-8&e=   <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_file_t346721_cyborg-5fbeetle.jpg&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hvb6yc0afr0prix27didhbsb1_rdnkep_gzcswpqn3a&s=zbkgch9v9i0cptc_2mab1ruqztd7swpqdezwpjlntne&e= >  our group is having open positions (postdocs and research engineers) for insect-computer hybrid system research. job description: join the team to develop insect-computer hybrid robots: the sensor-backpack mounting on living insects to (i) report environmental conditions and (ii) electronically stimulate their neurons and muscles to navigate them on demands. develop algorithm, software architecture, execute coding, troubleshoot and debug software solution. integrate and test software solution with sensor-backpack and living insect. technical write up and presentation. job requirements: degrees (phd if applying for postdoc) in mechatronics/ electronics/computer engineering/ robotics. experience with c/c++ and c# programming. experience in real time embedded system hardware and software development. experience in programming with real time operation system. experience in wireless communications (ble and sub-ghz) is advantageous. knowledge and experience in insect anatomy and physiology are not necessary. a team player and technically motivated to solve problems. good interpersonal and communication skills. interested candidates may contact professor sato at hirosato(at)ntu.edu.sg or dr nguyen thanh luan at tlnguyen at ntu.edu.sg for application. -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hvb6yc0afr0prix27didhbsb1_rdnkep_gzcswpqn3a&s=httnrfsa9wvhilxzybc742htr5iee6rqpr1coigjw9u&e=
